story:
A Scientific Breakthrough Changes the Way We Control Deadly Insect Pests

As part of the Grand Challenges in Global Health Program of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, a grant was awarded to biologists at Vanderbilt University that allowed them to make a discovery that may help eradicate Malaria and completely change the way humans protect themselves from insect pests.  The discovery appears to be the most powerful and versatile insect repellent ever discovered - more than 1000 times more potent than DEET.  To date it has shown no harmful effects on humans and other animals.


The breakthrough molecule -- nicknamed VUAA for Vanderbilt University Allosteric Agonist (for now) -- works by targeting an insect's sense of smell, the primary way in which they find animals and plants to feed upon.  The molecule completely overwhelms insects by turning on every single odorant receptor (the molecule on the insect's "nose" that normally responds to odors) they have.   Because VUAA’s molecular target is shared by all insect but is NOT found in humans or other mammals, this overload should ONLY effect insects.


Mosquitoes, for example, find human hosts for blood meals by detecting and responding to certain odors (such as carbon dioxide from our breath).  Turning on all of the mosquitoe's odorant receptors at the same time not only prevents the insect from detecting nearby humans to feed on, it also irritates the mosquito so much that it gets out of the area.  The mosquito is both confused and aggravated at the same time - the ultimate repellent.


Here is a very simple explanation of how it works on mosquitos: 


Help End Malaria

Of all the insect-related crises, it’s hard to find one more tragic than malaria.  Every year, malaria spread by Anopheles mosquitoes wipes over 600,000 people.  That is the size of the entire population of Portland, Oregon, or Denver, Colorado, or Frankfurt, Germany.  The sad truth is that most of malaria’s victims are younger than four years-old.  Citadel wants to eliminate this plague completely, and make malaria into a sad history and not tragic annual statistics.
A repellent with the strength and promise of VUAA could protect entire villages from mosquitoes and save hundreds of thousand of lives!!!  


No More Neuro-toxins!

On our Farms


Insect pests are such a persistent and costly problem that we regularly use whatever we can to get them away from us.  This includes neurotoxins and other poisons.  Every year, insects kill millions of people and domestic animals, destroy billions of dollars of crops and food, and some of them even eat our buildings.  Leading economists estimate that in many developing countries, insects destroy up to 10% of the GDP.


Dousing our food with these neurotoxins presents a health danger and risk on many levels:

  • danger to the applicators that come into direct contact with the chemicals;
  • risk to the water supply and aquatic life from runoff;
  • risk to non-target pests;
  • risk to those that eventually eat the food due to toxin residue -- even small amounts of toxins can build up and accumulate over time

Citadel Protectant's breakthrough technology could protect entire fields of crops across the globe from insect pests, which would allow protection without dousing our food with harmful chemicals!

Imagine protection from destructive insects without altering our food with harmful chemicals.


In and Around our Homes

In addition to mosquitos, the technology has been shown to work on other insects, with ants being an early research target.  There is every reason to believe VUAA1 will also repel every insect pest that plagues us in our everyday lives.

VUAA1 could keep roaches, ants, centipedes, mosquitoes, termites – you name it - away from our kitchens, backyards, gardens and the wood in our buildings.  And without having to spray toxic chemicals in places where such substances really should not be.  Why kill the harmful insects and potentially harm ourselves with toxic chemicals when we can simply move the harmful insects away from the areas needing protection with a powerful repellent?

VUAA1 creates a new concept in home insect pest control.  “Move them away, keep them away.”




Bill Gates has taken note of the technology his foundation funded and agrees on the exciting potential.  Just take a look at his Facebook page:


Dozens of media outlets have taken note as well.  VUAA has been highlighted on the following (and others!):



CNN Story - A Bug Repellent that Could Save Lives
Popular Science Story - New Insect Repellent 1000 Times Stronger than DEET
ABC Story - Super Cure for Mosquitos


Bill Gates The Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation has highlighted the exciting technology:


So How Exactly Does it Work?

The VUAA molecule is unlike any other substance known to science because of the way it specifically and narrowly interacts with a particular odorant receptor that densely populates insects' antennae.  Specifically, VUAA interacts with a receptor called Orco (this is the receptor that is unique to insects) which is closely tied to and required for function of all the insects' other odorant receptors.  When an insect comes into contact with VUAA, it signals Orco to "turn on" all of the insects odorant receptors at the same time, causing the irritating sensation of what amounts to smelling the worlds' strongest imaginable scents all at once.  As one can imagine, this is not a pleasant sensation and, not surprisingly, the insect flees instantly.


The beauty of this discovery, however, lies not only in how effective the molecule is at repelling insects (from both irritation and confusion), but in the fact that it is likely to have little or no chemical activity (from a scientific standpoint) outside of interacting with the highly specialized insect Orco receptor.  This means that, because humans and other animals do not have an Orco receptor, VUAA should have no impact on humans or animals at all.  


What We Need and What you Get


Citadel Protectants, the company developing and commercializing VUAA, needs funding for additional testing and formulation development efforts to bring this technology to the global market.   Government regulations require extraordinary testing to show efficacy and a lack of toxicity (initial toxicity tests have shown no toxicity to humans or mammals), which cost millions of dollars and is why typically only large multi-national chemical companies can bring new solutions to market.  


The initial $150,000 we currently seek will provide necessary funding for independent laboratory testing to support large-scale field trials and formulation.  This technology promises to be one of the most impactful breakthroughs in the fight against malaria and can change the use of pesticides forever.  However, this additional testing is required to determine the best ways to deliver the technology in the form of a usable product (i.e. spray, mist, etc.).  Supporting this campaign will be a meaningful step towards reducing the use of pesticides around the world as well as potentially saving the lives of millions.

    The Impact

    More than 600,000 people die of malaria each year.  Why?  Because in addition to the absence of a practical medical solution against the pathogen, there is no safe, practical way of keeping mosquitoes away from vulnerable people in developing countries.  Until now.  VUAA has the potential to keep malaria-carrying mosquitoes away from entire villages, thereby helping stop this deadly disease.  This technology can literally change the world.  Who doesn't want to be a part of that?


    While CitadelProtectants is not a non-profit company, our mandate is to help developing countries fight malaria by leveraging any sales we have in the developed world to provide access to this new technology.  We are committed to providing significant resources to fight malaria and will do so with VUAA.

      The Team

      A team of four professionals - the founding scientist, a seasoned entrepreneur, a marketing/communications executive and a chemical formulation chemist - have partnered with Vanderbilt University to commercialize the technology and develop a range of  products that will harness this technology to manage unwanted insects, including mosquitoes that carry malaria as well as Dengue, West Nile and Chikungunya viruses that spread disease around the world.

      Among the founding team, there is over 50 years of product development experience and expertise.  The lead scientist holds over 10 pest control related patents and assisted in formulating some of the world's most impactful chemicals at one of the largest chemical companies in the world.

      Dr. Larry Zwiebel, the Vanderbilt scientist that discovered VUAA1:


      Ken Fersch, Head Formulation Chemist for Citadel Protectants:

      Bruce Harned, Marketing Communications, Product Development & President of Citadel Protectants:


      Risks & Challenges

      We are still a ways away from a commercially available product.  While this technology is perhaps the most promising breakthrough in insect control during our lifetime, hundreds of additional tests must be completed to ensure safety and effectiveness before we can get the technology to market.

      Remember is this is brand new, breakthrough technology.  There is a possibility that VUAA will fail to perform at some point in its development phase.

story:
Short Summary

I have been diagnosed with Recurrent Corneal Erosion. In case you don't know what that means, I've lost the outermost layer my cornea and I'm in tremendous pain. The pain medication could destroy my corneas entirely, so I've just had to deal with the mind-numbing, excruciating pain.  

What I Need

The good news is the doctor said it will heal. The bad news is it will happen again without surgery, hence why I am here asking for help. The surgery is $4,300 and is the equivalent of LASIK. I would love to get back to my normal life where I can be the Glamazon producer you've come to know and love where I'm not in constant pain half-blind. Here is where you come in.

Campaign Update:  Thanks to a huge contribution I have reached the initial goal for my surgery.  The $2000.00 goal was set because that is what the origonal eye doctor estimated surgery to be.  Today (Wednesday, October 15th), I finally got in to see a surgeon who quoted me $4300 to fix BOTH eyes.  This is for surgery alone not accounting other medical expenses, loss of work, etc that I have already and will continue to incur.  So, the goal that was originally set is less than half of what I need to raise.  I do not want to start a different campaign and have others think I am falsifying information.  My doctor is actually a team who have won literally dozens of awards in restorative laser eye surgery with TLC Laser Eye Centers in Greenville, SC and they will accept payments directly to them for my surgery as well.  If that is something you are interested in doing I have set up a special account with them and can deliver that information upon request.  Being the internet and sketchy people I do not want to give out all information here. 

THANK YOU SO MUCH everyone for supporting me.  Every dollar will go to my surgery, recovery and expenses incurred.  I could have not made it this far without the help and support of amazing friends who have come to my side.   You know who you are.  Thank you, I love you.  
To those who continue to support: Every ounce of your generosity is felt and I promise to pay it forward in multiples.  <3 <3 <3

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
    • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello Everyone! Thank you for taking the time to stop by this page.

 

My name is Marjolaine and I am a close friend of Wendy's. I met Wendy through our place of business when she decided to start sharing her positive experience by teaching meditation weekly to co-workers. In my opinion, it has been Wendy's selflessness, gentle and giving spirit as well as her dedication that has seen Wendy's meditation class and her message of mindfulness grow larger than she ever could have imagined. Over these years our relationship has blossomed in to a friendship I am truly blessed to have. Wendy has become my confidant, cheerleader and someone I look up to.

Why I am doing this:

 

When I learned of Wendy's recent quest to obtain cancer reoccurrence monitoring (being a breast cancer survivor herself) and subsequent initial result being "cause for concern" I knew that I wanted to help but didn't know how.  Please know it is not cancer for certain but that if it is, it was caught very early thanks to Wendy's being proactive (further testing will provide more concrete answers.) As my family has directly been affected by life threatening disease (losing my mother to pancreatic cancer in late 2013) I understand what a burden the question "How can I help?" can be, as it is often exhausting trying to understand and/or put into words what you need.  

It was when I spoke with Wendy further and she provided additional details into her decision to pursue an integrative approach to her health care (Please click here for more info on Integrative Health featured on Wendy's personal Blog), that I learned that most testings and treatment would be coming out of her pocket. Wendy has started immunotherapy treatment (that is very promising) to boost the immune system and therefore eradicate any cancer. In learning of the financial cost and her amazing treatment already underway, the question to how I could help became clear. With Wendy's blessing (based solely on her quest to spread awareness (see more below.)) I have created this page so that we can all come together and help provide the support, financial freedom to choose her own path to health and the peace of mind Wendy has so willingly taught us over the years.

 

What I am requesting:

 

At this time I have created a small completely attainable goal of $1000. I have seen the amazing amount of people Wendy has positively affected at work and I have no doubt that her reach extends far beyond that. All funds will go directly to Wendy herself so that she can put them towards the expenses of treatment and testing that has already amounted up to more than $7000!

 

Wendy's Plan to Pay it Forward:

 

As I stated before, Wendy has allowed me to create this page based solely on spreading her story. Her goal is to be able to share her learning's a few months down the road when this treatment has been successful. She plans to share with a wider audience through her blog called MeaningfulWesternLife. I suggest that you take the time to enjoy her blog as she has many wonderful postings related to cultivating joy and meaning in a western society lifestyle. by clicking the link above, you have access to all of her posts but you may like to sign up by entering your email address on her website so you will get notifications of posts relating to her treatment, learning's and success. These important lessons are about taking a proactive, integrative approach to one’s own health and having the courage to seek beyond the mainstream system when needed; otherwise your options are very limited. Already many people are seeking the knowledge Wendy has gained.

 

How to Donate:

 

Please note there are two options if you choose to donate financially. You may donate directly through credit card or using PayPal. You do not have to own a PayPal account to donate through this option (you can use it as a guest.) It is important that you understand the limitations that a wonderful page like this involves and it does come at a cost. Although Indiegogo charges the lowest amount I could find on fundraising pages, a per transaction cost of 3% will be deducted and in addition a 9% fee will be deducted from the donation total. The great news is that if (and when :) ) the donation goal is met (or exceeded) the fee will lower to 4% PLUS PayPal transactions will be credited by 5%. Please be aware that credit card donations will not be received by Wendy until 2 weeks after the closing date and that PayPal transactions are immediate so I gracefully request that you consider PayPal as your primary donation option.

Please understand that a financial donation is by no means expected nor the only way to show your support. Wendy is grateful to receive your caring, friendship, healing and well wishes. For those of you familiar with her meditation teachings-please take the time to send her healing white light.

 

Thank YOU! Thank YOU! Thank YOU!

 

So very much from the bottom of my heart for taking the opportunity to read right down to the very end. By reading this and sharing with your friends and family YOU are all instrumental in the beautiful symphony that is Wendy's life. Namaste.

 

With deep gratitude,

Marjolaine

story:
Help Provide Talented Youth in Ghana a Chance to Explore Their Talents


Why This Project?

With the majority of the population in Ghana, Africa under the age of 24, the country’s future prosperity will depend on how well their youths survive and thrive. Population estimates show that 38.9% of Ghanaians are under the age of 14. Many are disadvantaged missing one parent or both making it difficult for them to find their best path and avoid poverty and other traps. Reaching this generation with positive reinforcement, encouragement and direction can help build a more prosperous tomorrow for the country. That’s where the Keno Project comes in…

 

The Keno Project helps young Ghanaians living in towns and villages find their true path by nurturing their natural talents. The first phase of the project is to provide a venue for children and young adults to exhibit their natural talents and be recognized and rewarded for them. The first of several “Talent Shows” is scheduled for Dec. 24th with try-outs starting now. More than 50 contestants can be accommodated in the show with awards given out to the top three winners. Every participant receives a Certificate of Completion and the satisfaction and confidence from having participated in such an event.

Who are We?

The organizer of the event is Richard Kwame Amewugah, the Founder and Artistic Director of Keno Cultural Group, a performance group based in Amasaman-Accra, Ghana specializing in native African dance and drumming. In addition to his leadership of the twenty five person African dance and drumming performance group, Keno, Richard’s experience includes being lead musician for TV Africa’s Amazing Child Season 4, Field Director for the Sankofa Center where he leads the school and village outreach programs, and music teacher at Firm Foundation Academy in Sapeiman, Ghana.

The Treasurer for the Keno Project is me, Cyndie Zikmund. I live in the San Francisco Bay Area and I’m a high tech geek who uses music and dance to stay grounded. I recently spent time volunteering for the Sankofa Center in Ghana where I learned several African dances from Richard and performed them with the Keno Group as part of the volunteer outreach program.  Richard’s vision of encouraging natural talent in youths to help them find their best path and way out of poverty appealed to my love of grass roots projects and using music and dance to build confidence in young people in order to change the world one dance step at a time.

What's Needed for the Talent Show

The Talent show will be managed by Richard on a volunteer basis and also staffed by volunteers from the Keno group. Donations will be accepted at the event to cover transportation costs and hopefully more for the group. We are not requesting payment from you for Keno's time or expenses.

The money being requested will go entirely to funding the event itself. Specifically it will cover the following expenses:

-  Rental of the performance location

-  Chairs

-  Banner

-  Spinner (aka "the DJ" to provide music for the performers)

-  Snacks and drinks for the performers

-  Compensation for the invited judges

-  Modest prizes for the top 3 winners

-  Certificates for every participant

-  Gifts for donors (certificates, recording of event, sm Djembe)

We have already received a seed donation of $500 to get the project started but need an additional $1700 to cover the above costs.

What You will Receive for Your Donation

Besides the satisfaction of knowing you’ve helped 50+ children in Africa explore their natural talent and our sincere gratitude, we’re giving commemorative Certificates of Contribution to anyone who donates $25 or more.  These certificates will be created and signed by Richard in Ghana and mailed to you. For donations of $75 or greater, we’ll also include a recording of the highlights of the event (provided we can get a video camera to the event -- still working on this one). And for donations of $750 or more you’ll receive a small Djembe (size 11) made in Ghana. They are beautiful!! And if you are in Ghana during the time of the event, you will be welcomed with open arms. 

Why Should You Help?

As with all funding requests, each person has his or her own reason for giving and it can be deeply personal. Respecting your own motivations, I can provide a few additional thoughts that come to mind:

1)  Satisfaction of backing a successful project that is now in its infancy but will grow over time into something big – and you can say “I supported Keno way back when…..”

2)  Helping a dedicated talented group make a difference in young people’s lives

3)  Contribute to creating a really fun evening for kids and their families

4)  it’s Christmas – a meaningful time of year to give.

What Happens if We Don’t Meet Our Goal?

The show must go on!! Posters are up and auditions start this Sunday – we’ll not turn back now. However if we come up short, we’ll have to make some adjustments like either going without the stage, giving up the chairs, cancelling the food and drink for the performers, or offering lesser prizes. But that would be sad!!

Please help us make this event the best it can be with all the trimmings!

What Happens if We Exceed Our Goal?

We’ll be ecstatic and grateful to all who contributed! PLUS any money left over after expenses are covered will go towards our next talent show in 2014. That’s right - this is the first of many such events. We intend to grow this idea into a regular cadence of events and eventually reach self-funding status.

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Spread the word. Share it on Facebook. Tweet about it. Share it in Email.

2. Tell your friends even when you see them in person!

3. Let's get excited!!!


Thank your for your consideration!!

Richard Kwame Amewugah and

Cyndie Zikmund

Help Provide Talented Youth in Ghana a
Chance to Explore Their TalentsWhy This Project?


With the majority of the population in Ghana, Africa under
the age of 24, the country’s future prosperity will depend on how well their
youths survive and thrive. Population estimates show that 38.9% of Ghanaians
are under the age of 14. Many are disadvantaged missing one parent or both
making it difficult for them to find their best path and avoid poverty and
other traps. Reaching this generation with positive reinforcement,
encouragement and direction can help build a more prosperous tomorrow for the country.
That’s where the Keno Project comes in…

villages find their true path by nurturing their natural talents. The first
phase of the project is to provide a venue for children and young adults to

story:
Missed it? You still got a chance!

 

Get FREE Samples On Our Website:

https://www.treetotub.com

Find Us On Amazon:

http://amzn.to/2qdU1fk

 

Healthiest Skin & Hair You’ve Ever Had

Did you know 99% of commercial soap is harming your body with synthetic lather every day? Harsh chemicals found in commercial soap are often toxic and can cause long-term damage to your skin & hair (e.g.  dryness, irritation, dandruff, split ends).

8 Months ago on Kickstarter, you helped us bring the 1st version of Soapberry Shampoo and Body Wash from our forest to your bathroom. Today, let’s replace all harsh chemicals in your body care with Soapberry Lather, Argan Oil, and Shea Butter.

The most gentle body care line-up straight from nature

 

Meet the Soapberry, Nature's Gentlest Soap

Just give this berry a rub to produce a creamy, luxurious lather

The Soapberry lathers nourish your body better than any other botanicals. For thousands of years, its pH-balanced and anti-inflammatory properties have been used in Ayurvedic dermatology as the healing soap for even the most delicate skin (e.g. sensitive skin, eczema, psoriasis). The Soapberry's antioxidant-packed froth not only shields the skin & hair from dryness, but also repairs and regenerates damaged cells.

What The Soapberry Will Do For You

Instead of synthetic lather that is severely damaging your body, the Soapberry will completely transform the health of even the most sensitive skin and damaged hair.

 

It's a simple choice. Why damage our bodies with chemical detergents when we can use the Soapberry? Today, we launch not 1, but 5 of the most gentle body care products, designed by nature, for all to enjoy.

 

                 

While chemical lather strips your natural oil and damages your skin, the Soapberry’s natural lather keeps your skin intact and in balance

 

 

 

The natural lather Soapberry has a natural pH of 5.5, the same as your skin, whereas commercial soap is far more alkaline, causing skin deterioration 

 

What Industry Experts Say About Tree To Tub

 
“The soapberry’s natural antibacterial property makes it the ideal alternative to synthetic soap. It’s the most revolutionary idea that I've heard in years!"
– Jessica Rubino, Personal Care Director, NewHope Media (Largest natural goods publication)

“Tree To Tub is giving customers the opportunity to be toxin-free and help ecosystems, with products that are hypo-allergenic, Fair Trade, non-GMO, and sustainably sourced”
– Sustainable Brands

"It's not just any other hot natural body care company, Tree To Tub definitely has a bigger vision. From the forest, to the farmers, to their wholesome products, every piece is in line with a philosophy of nature's gentleness" 
–  Melody Koh, Head of Product, Blue Apron
 

Pledge now, and choose your preferences after the campaign. You will be able to completely customize your bundle, choose any scent, and switch out one product for another. And yes, we ship internationally!

Pledge now, and choose your preferences after the campaign. You will be able to completely customize your bundle, choose any scent, and switch out one product for another. And yes, we ship internationally!

                   

Receive it in our beautiful & 100% recyclable packaging

 

We don't just want to make the world's most gentle solutions. We want to make a better world. That's why we partner with local communities and eco-reserves in Taiwan to harvest the wild soapberry, all harmlessly. Inspired by ancient tradition, we preserve harmony with nature throughout the entire process. With our patented extraction technology, we bring the soapberry from the forests to our homes.

Every fall, we harvest wild soapberries in the eco-reserves of Taiwan; not a single is tree cut down. Better than organic, our soapberries are wild and sustainable.

We then dry the soapberries under the sun, and separate the seeds from the fruits. The seeds are then made into meditation beads, the only by-product is sacred.

Then we take the seedless soapberry fruits through our patented eco-friendly extraction process that's inspired by ancient tradition.

The extracted soapberry then is bottled and shipped to San Francisco, then later shipped to your doorstep in 100% recyclable packaging.  

"During my childhood in Taiwan...my grandmother never had to worry about chemicals harming my sensitive, fragile skin. She relied on nature - all we used was a fruit called the soapberry. She would trek deep into the forest, harvest the berries, and bathe me in its rich, nourishing lather. Little did I know that I would eventually leave my hometown, and immigrate to America, where I saw countless others suffer from harsh, toxic chemicals. Now, I'm committed to bringing the soapberry and other nature's offerings from the tree to tub, and healing bodies worldwide."

- Michael, Founder of Tree To Tub

 

FAQ

When will you ship out the products?

As soon as you fill out the survey! We've shipped out most backers' rewards, and will continue shipping out new orders.

How do I pick my scent and specific products in my bundle?

You will fill out a survey after the campaign ends, and over there you can specify your preferred scent and product combination. You could either go with our default bundles (e.g. the Day/Night Set) or completely build your own.

Do you ship internationally?

Yes we do. We also help you out with more than 50% of the shipping cost, since our products are not light. The shipping rate depends on weight of the package you choose, but for example, the Basic bundle normally would cost $75 to ship to let's say Japan, but you'll only pay $35 ($15 for Canada).

How big are the bottles, and how long can I use the products for?

The face wash is a 6 fl oz bottle, while all the other bottles are 11 oz. The face wash would take a couple months to finish, while the other ones will take anywhere from 3 weeks to 2 months, depending on how much you use and how often you wash.

What scent should I choose?

You will be able to choose your scent after the campaign. If you shower right when you get up in the morning, you might want to go with Awakening Peppermint – the invigorating essential oils will get you ready for the day. If you shower right before bed, then you might want to go with Relaxing Lavender, which lets your mind and body wind down for a restful night. And if you are sensitive to scents, or just don’t like or need any fragrance, then we always have Raw Unscented available.

Are you certified organic?

In short, we’re working on it. It takes 3 years to certify the soapberry eco-reserves as USDA Organic, and the cost is just not feasible right now for a small company like ours. However, the soapberries are not only organic, but also completely wild, even more sustainable than traditional organic farming. 

Are you certified vegan?

Yes, we’re proudly certified vegan by PETA.

Are you certified cruelty-free? 

Yes, we’re proudly certified cruelty-free by PETA.

We love your stuff! How can we purchase again?

We can not guarantee supply for some of our products outside our Indiegogo campaign, learn more at www.treetotub.com

Do you use perfume or artificial fragrance?

Absolutely not. Artificial fragrance/perfume is cheaper, but could be extremely toxic and cause severe allergic reactions. We only use premium French essential oils, and that's also why it's important to keep your bottles closed to prevent evaporation. With Tree To Tub, every bath time is aroma therapy time.

What are your ingredients?

Soapberry Facial Cleanser Ingredients:

SAPINDUS MUKOROSSI (Organic Soapberry) JUICE, ALOE BARBADENSIS LEAF (Organic Aloe Vera) JUICE, DECYL GLUCOSIDE (from Coconut), EUTERPE OLERACEA (Organic Açaí) EXTRACT, MATRICARIA CHAMOMILLA (Organic Chamomile) EXTRACT, CAPRYLYL GLYCOL (From Coconut) & DIPROPYLENE GLYCOL & GLYCERYL CAPRYLATE (From Coconut), BUTYROSPERMUM PARKII (Organic Shea Butter)

Soapberry Body Wash Ingredients:

ORGANIC SAPINDUS MUKOROSSI (Soapberry) JUICE, ALOE BARBADENSIS LEAF (Aloe Vera) JUICE, COCAMIDOPROPYL BETAINE (From Coconut), DECYL GLUCOSIDE (From Coconut), SODIUM LAURYL SULFOACETATE (From Coconut), CUCUMIS SATIVUS FRUIT (Cucumber) EXTRACT, CAPRYLYL GLYCOL (From Coconut) & DIPROPYLENE GLYCOL & GLYCERYL CAPRYLATE (From Coconut), CITRIC ACID, ORGANIC CHAMOMILE EXTRACT, ORGANIC BUTYROSPERMUM PARKII (Shea Butter)

Soapberry Shampoo Ingredients:

ORGANIC SAPINDUS MUKOROSSI (Soapberry) JUICE, ALOE BARBADENSIS LEAF (Aloe Vera) JUICE, COCAMIDOPROPYL BETAINE (From Coconut), DECYL GLUCOSIDE (From Coconut), SODIUM LAURYL SULFOACETATE (From Coconut), POLYQUATERNIUM-7, CENTELLA ASIATICA (Gotu Kola) LEAF EXTRACT, CAPRYLYL GLYCOL (From Coconut) & DIPROPYLENE GLYCOL & GLYCERYL CAPRYLATE (From Coconut), CITRIC ACID, ORGANIC CHAMOMILE EXTRACT, ORGANIC OLEA EUROPAEA (Olive) LEAF EXTRACT

Argan Oil Conditioner Ingredients:

ALOE BARBADENSIS LEAF (Organic Aloe Vera) JUICE, SAPINDUS MUKOROSSI (Organic Soapberry) JUICE, CETEARYL ALCOHOL (From Coconut), CETRIMONIUM CHLORIDE, GLYCERYL STEARATE (From Soy), ARGANIA SPINOSA KERNEL OIL (Organic Argan Oil), BUTYROSPERMUM PARKII (Organic Shea Butter), COCOS NUCIFERA (Organic Coconut Oil), DISTEARYL DIMETHYL AMMONIUM CHLORIDE, POLYQUATERNIUM-67, BEHENTRIMONIUM CHLORIDE (From Oilseed Turnip) & ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL, CAPRYLYL GLYCOL (From Coconut) & DIPROPYLENE GLYCOL & GLYCERYL CAPRYLATE (From Coconut), PUNICA GRANATUM (Organic Pomegranate) EXTRACT

Shea Butter Body Lotion Ingredients:

ALOE BARBADENSIS (Organic Aloe Vera) JUICE, SAPINDUS MUKOROSSI (Organic Soapberry) JUICE, BUTYROSPERMUM PARKII (Organic Shea Butter), THEOBROMA CACAO (Organic Cocoa Butter), GLYCERIN (Vegan), COCO-CAPRATE (From Coconut), SODIUM LEVULINATE (From Sugar Cane), SODIUM ANISATE (From Fennel), CETEARYL OLIVATE (From Olive), SORBITAN OLIVATE (From Olive), AVENA SATIVA (Oatmeal), METHYLPROPANEDIOL (From Coconut), PHENYLPROPANOL (From Coconut), CAPRYLYL GLYCOL (From Coconut), LECITHIN (From Soy), MATRICARIA CHAMOMILLA (Organic Chamomile) EXTRACT

story:
On December 28, 2012, Gail Occhialini went in to the doctors to check up on a persistent cough and headache and thought that she would just be given some antibiotics and be told to rest.  Instead, she was rushed to the hospital because her doctor was alarmed at her severely low red blood counts and she was later diagnosed with Leukemia (Acute Myeloid Leukemia Type M4).  There was no time to adjust to the news.  Gail was immediately put on chemotherapy.  
 
The rounds of treatment will be aggressive and intense.  Each treatment will require her to be in the hospital for 28 days, and she may have to endure up to four treatments,  meaning she may not be able to go home until April.  In the span of one month, she's had to battle the side effects of chemotherapy, deal with countless bone marrow biopsies, and treat the pneumonia in her right lung.  Currently she is in the Intensive Care Unit, undergoing dialysis treatments.
 
Throughout all of this, though, Gail's attitude and strength have been amazing as she continues to bravely undergo her chemotherapy treatment at Winter Park Memorial Hospital.  
 
Due to the fact that Gail can no longer work, her long hospital stay, the expensive cancer treatment drugs, the accumulating medical expenses and other bills at home, we want to do whatever it takes to ease some of the burden.  We ask friends and family to please share your love and support for Gail and the Occhialini family during this challenging time.  If you can, please consider donating to Gail's campaign.  We would appreciate any donations, large or small, or even something as simple as a prayer.
 
Please check in on Gail's Facebook page at: https://www.facebook.com/gail.occhialini for current updates and to send any kind thoughts and positive love her way.
 
Our heartfelt thanks for your generosity!
 
As an aside:  The amount of $500 was a default suggestion through this website that cannot be changed.   Even if we reach our goal, we acknowledge that medical and other expenses will definitely cost beyond $500 and thank you for your continued support.

story:
Dear friends, family, and allies,

First and foremost, thank you sincerely for taking the time to open your heart to this cause. We truly appreciate your willingness to understand and support this very sensitive and very personal need.

AN INTRODUCTION TO JES: Jes Ryan Bradshaw is a 27 year old individual from Houston, TX now living and working full time in Portland, Oregon. Jes is a goofball with an incredibly kind heart and a passion for people.  Jes has struggled with gender identity since childhood. Despite trying to fit into a mold designed by social norms, Jes has never associated comfortably with the female gender.  Jes identifies as androgynous, and is still very much in the thick of finding a pronoun that fits.

Jes has been using a binder, which compresses the chest area, for about a year now (imagine a modern day corset). This has helped reduce anxiety associated with body identity issues, but binding is not sustainable long term given it’s health risks, and it's time for a positive change. After careful thought and with the immense support of Jes' therapist and loved ones, Jes is scheduled to have top surgery performed by Dr. Michael Brownstein in San Francisco in May.

Here’s an intro to Dr. Brownstein, if you’re curious:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5WEA3p1Eq3U
---

WHAT ARE THE COSTS OF SURGERY? Unfortunately, this surgery is not cheap, and Jes’ insurance will not cover a dime. The cost of surgery alone will be $8,500. Because the outpatient surgery is not available locally, Jes will have to travel to San Francisco for the 10 day process. Thanks to the generosity of Jes’ family, the only funds now left to raise are in support of airfare, food, lodging, and the cost of time off work during the healing process! Since work in Weatherization requires extensive physical labor, and Jes’s chest will require about three months to fully heal, Jes will also likely be out of work during a good portion of the healing process. These remaining costs are estimated to total $3,000.

WHY JES DESERVES YOUR SUPPORT: For those of you who may not know Jes closely, you should know that your support is well deserved. Jes is just one those few people who are impossible not to love. Jes is extraordinarily compassionate, giving, and a true spirit-lifter. In spite of saving carefully, Jes’s current income will not support these costs in full. As loved ones and trusted allies, we turn to you. Any little bit you can spare, be it in the form of money, encouragement, well wishes, drawings, cards or experiences, will be greatly appreciated. We know Jes will be overwhelmed with gratitude by anything you are willing and able to contribute on this tremendously powerful journey.

“There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside of you” -Maya Angelou

story:
Bamboo For Eczema & other Skin Conditions.
Thank You for taking the time to consider our project.

What do you mean Clothing for Eczema & other skin conditions?
Due to the painful & irrepressible itchy rash that accompanies Severe Eczema, EB, Psoriasis & Allergy sufferers need to wear super soft clothing that can withstand high temperature HOT Washing (To remove all the heavy emollients & steroid creams often needed).


Sounds Simple Doesn't it?Unfortunately its not just a matter of popping down to your local shopping centre & finding some nice soft clothes. A whole range of things (such as seams & necklines) need to be re engineered so as not to cause irritation that can lead to scratching, bleeding & infection.

Currently No Eczema Clothing is Made for Summer/Hot climates!Can you believe this? 1 in 3 people are living with Eczema & there is no clothing made for warmer climates. All the eczema clothing currently sold is sourced out of Europe & the UK, Which is often made of heavy fabrics not suitable for the warmer Climates. It is also virtually IMPOSSIBLE to find this specialist clothing for adults.

Why Bamboo?

Specialists (such as dermatologists & immunologists) recommend this type of clothing for relief.

- Bamboo is Environmentally Sustainable & has a low carbon footprint.
- Bamboo is Temperature Regulating (this is a huge problem for people with Eczema & Allergies as overheating can cause the rash to flare, Bamboo has the amazing natural feature of being able to stabilise temperature, Its cool in summer & comfortable in winter).
- Bamboo naturally has anti-fungal & anti-bacterial qualities (Important as Infection can be a huge problem with eczema, EB & Psoriasis)
- Bamboo can withstand Hot Washing needed to remove eczema creams & heavy emollients.

Where will the Money pledged Go?

The research I have completed has shown us we need $38 990 to create & manufacture this clothing. I am putting my own money into this project,therefore 100% of Your Very Generously donated money will go towards:

- 63% Actual Manufacturing. (currently negotiating with small run family business of manufacturers)This covers Fabric, Materials & labour
- 13% Samples need to be sent to lab for testing to gain the Clothing Standards Certification (We have already tried & tested numerous Bamboo fabrics & seam types however they need to be professionally made to withstand the testing needed for certification).
- 12% Professional design & creation of templates/patterns (required by manufacturers)
- 7% Eczema Association Promotion - So that those with Eczema can find our product we need to join the Eczema Association as a Corporate member.
- 5% Packaging & Marketing Materials

Can you make it happen?

Yes I can!
When it comes to Eczema & Allergies & knowing what people want & need I have almost 20yrs experience as a Nurse including time in Children’s Ward & working with Infection Control where I was first exposed to caring for patients with Eczema, Asthma & Allergies. We know specialists are recommending this type of clothing, but currently there is none in production.
Have A Question?
Please don't hesitate to ask!
www.facebook.com/Bambooforeczema


Thank You Beautiful People for taking the time to consider our Project. 
We can't wait to see your name on our wall of Awesomeness!

Join us on Facebook Here

Join us on Twitter Here

story: Hello! My name is Patrick Jay Spranger. I am 20 years old living with my family in Southern Arizona. I enjoy drawing and doing outdoor activities. After I had Gradutated High School I intended to joing the Military.  I first went to an Army recruiting station here in Sierra Vista, AZ and signed myself up.  After a whole year of in DEP training I have excelled to rank of an E3 right before going to Basic.  I was really excited to be going into the Army and doing what I really wanted to do ((Multi launch rocket guidance)). However, Due to some major set back while at the MEP station.  After a long year and ready to head out I have reached a breaking point to further my future career.  I have been told from the Sergeon General of the Military that My waiver for my eyes have been disqualified.  I was quite devistated to the fact the day I was suppose to be leaving is no longer something to look forward to anymore.  I went down to the Doctor in Downtown Phoenix to get my eyes checked out and I was told my vision has been decreasing slowly.  I am aware now that I have a Permenant Cornea Damage; or "Glaucoma" in terms.  I have had Eye Allergies since I was 13, but I never thought it would get this bad.  A doctor in Sierra Vista prescribed me some Steroid eye drops to decrease the pain.  He informed me that an over access can cause damage to the eyes.  Hoever he recommended that I take them whenever my eyes have a strong stining pain for more than 15 seconds. I have been having constant pains in the eye for about a year and a half so I had no choice but to use it.  The Doctors did not really do much for my eyes besides checking them and giving me prescriptions.  I really fear of losing my vision and I really need to start somewhere... I still want to joing the Army and I am trying to do everything possible to save up.  The only way I can save my Vision is getting an Eye cornea transplant which I know is very pricey.. I just need to keep trying. I would appreciate it beyond anything if you could take the time as you did reading this and help me with my eyes.. It means a lot to me and I don't know if I could just live my life blind; not doing a lot of things that I enjoy doing or making my future better for myself.. It would mean a lot to me.  My family is aware of the situation however I don't think nothing was ever done about it.. they are really glad that my allergies have not been kicking is for about 6 months so far thankfully, but I do not want to take any risks not doing anything.. thank you for your time and God bless.

story:
Vocal Energetics: Judith Lynne and her work in sound healing adapted for Parkinson’s patients

 

Background of The Project

In 2008, while filming the award-winning documentary “Vibration for Healing, the Sound You Feel” we featured Judith Kahealani Lynne, as she sounded with the dolphins in Kona, Hawaii. She was one of 20 sound healers featured in the documentary. (http://www.cezeproductions.net/featured-film/)

Although she was unaware of it, she was already suffering from Parkinson’s.  In 2010, after a two-year struggle, Judith - a trained musician - started to use her self-developed “vocal energetics” on herself. As she got stronger, she began to work again. Now she hopes to share her work with a larger audience. 

 

“My exploration of the Parkinson’s world revealed studies showing the benefits of meditation, qigong, tai chi and a voice programs for voice and speech improvement. Quickly I recognized the value of the Vocal Energetics™ program for Parkinson’s as it included elements of each of these items and more. I revamped, mainstreamed and offered workshops. Attendees with PD reported improved balance, improved vocal projection, diction and melody, diminished or ceasing of tremors, and mood elevation. The toning meditation practice was helpful especially for those who find difficulty in quieting the mind, which can be a challenge for a person with PD as worry, agitation, and suffering anxiety about possible futures are typical emotional expressions. The deep peace felt by being in present moment, lowers the pulse and blood pressure, calms all systems of the body and supports mental clarity.” - Judith Lynne

 

By the spring of 2012, as Judith Lynne was giving workshops at national Parkinson’s Conferences, she was asked to make a DVD of her work available so that participants could take the “work” home and continue all the exercises they were taught. She asked us to produce it. We agreed that this DVD would provide an incredible tool to help people with Parkinson’s in meeting their journey.

The Project

Because Judith shares her time between Portland, Oregon and her spiritual home in Hawaii, it is in these two locations that this video project is being produced.

The first part of this project was the creation of a short toning/meditation video. Graciously funded by the Lyman Fund, it is now posted on a YouTube site http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TMXnEsrWmV8 and a Vimeo site https://vimeo.com/72166178

The second part of the project is the creation of a full-length DVD which will include a documentary about Judith Lynne, her journey and her work. For the PD community, the producers feel that the most important part of the DVD will be the special features. These features will include:

  • a short toning/meditation
  • a long toning/meditation
  • specific vocal exercises
  • exercises to relieve the Parkinson's mask
  • segments of Judith’s workshop presentations, used as reinforcements
  • the role of body movement, etc.

The completed DVD will be made available at nominal cost primarily to workshop participants, so that, through the special features, the PD community will be able to continue their progress in "partnering with Parkinson's."

 

Financial Goal and Projected Use of Funds

We've set a minimum goal of $28,800 to cover the costs of travel, lodging, production and post-production of all additional material to complete the DVD. In addition, we will supply 1,000 replicated copies of the DVD.

 

Why you may want to sponsor us

All of us know someone struggling with PD. In recent years, the interest in the use of alternative healing modalities has grown rapidly as People with Parkinson's (PWPs) search for avenues of managing their symptoms and increasing their quality of life. And everyone is hopeful that at some point a cure will be found.

Vocal EnergeticsTM offers an especially unique way to address multiple symptoms of Parkinson's. Not only does it help with the motor symptoms of balance, integrated movement, tremors, posture, swallowing, good breathing and vocal production, it also assists in meeting the non-motor issues of self-confidence, worry, depression, hopelessness, integrated and authentic expression, social inclusion, focused thought, peace of mind, and living in present moment.

Your support for the production of this DVD will help many people who find themselves "suffering" from Parkinson's. They will have a powerful tool to assist them in meeting their symptoms, even possibly to lessen the need for increased doses of pharmaceuticals that over time have difficult side-effects. 

“Parkinson's is a Path of the Warrior. In order to meet the challenge we must draw on all the strength that we can muster from within. It is essential that we gather the resources - physically, emotionally, mentally, and spiritually -  to meet these conditions, to not be over-powered by them, but to truly "partner with Parkinson's". In that way, Parkinson's calls out the best from within each of us.

Vocal Energetics has been an invaluable tool for me in my journey with PD. I know that it can and will serve others well, too.” - Judith Lynne

This DVD will be extremely useful, educational and most of all – extremely practical. As filmmakers, the Ceze Films team concentrates on projects that document people in their quest for more spiritual, healthful and earth-friendly life styles. In this spirit we want to help Judith Kahealani Lynne make this possible.

How you can help:

  1. Pledge the amount with which you feel comfortable. We are grateful for any amount AND be sure to select one of our great perks!
  2. Forward this Indiegogo page to the friends and family members whom you think may be interested in Judith's work and/or would like to sponsor us.
  3. “Like” our Ceze Films Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/pages/Ceze-Films/166623926698582?ref=hl
  4. Follow our progress at www.CezeFilms.com
  5. Support Judith Lynne’s work at http://www.partneringwithparkinsons.com/index.html

It is essential that we gather the resources - physically, emotionally, mentally, and spiritually -  to meet these conditions, to not be over-powered by them, but to truly "partner with Parkinson's". In that way, Parkinson's calls out the best from within each of us.
Vocal Energetics has been an invaluable tool for me in my journey with PD. I know that it can and will serve others well, too.” - Judith Lynne
This DVD will be extremely useful, educational and most of all – extremely practical. As filmmakers, the Ceze Films team concentrates on projects that document people in their quest for more spiritual, healthful and earth-friendly life styles. In this spirit we want to help Judith Kahealani Lynne make this possible.
How you can help:

Pledge the amount with which you feel comfortable. We are grateful for any amount AND be sure to select one of our great perks!
Forward this Indiegogo page to the friends and family members whom you think may be interested in Judith's work and/or would like to sponsor us.
“Like” our Ceze Films Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/pages/Ceze-Films/166623926698582?ref=hl

Follow our progress at www.CezeFilms.com

Support Judith Lynne’s work at http://www.partneringwithparkinsons.com/index.html

story:
Hello Everyone! =D

I'm Sienna Grace! Transgender Entertainter & aspiring therapist
Raising funds for Breast Augmentation & Laser Hair Removal
By helping me out, you are helping to change & enhance other people's lives as well.

Trying to raise $7,000 to pay for Breast Augmentation and Laser Hair Removal
If the goal is not met, the funds will still go towards the procedures mentioned,
as I am saving myself.

You know that feeling that you get when you've
accomplished something in life. The feeling that took so much out of
you to achieve. I've been striving for a long time to become the person
that I have always felt inside. At times I wanted to give up, but it's
a new life for me, and I'm going to be a leader.

I am not stuck up, but I believe that I currently do, and will continue
to bring joy into people's lives in many ways. I feel confident when I say that I was put on this earth to help people in any way I can. I get so much satisfaction out of doing it...Even if this fundraiser is a complete failure and I don't raise anything, my intentions won't change. Just another challenge in life.

I am extremely grateful for the human experience to begin with. I mean,
we're so tiny it's incredible! Life is just amazing...think about it.
Nobody ever told us that we were going to be born. Nobody ever promised us a life after death.
But we're alive, here, now.

I tell everyone that they can have anything in the world if they want it
bad enough. 

Live your dreams, love life. =)

Everything is appreciated, even if you cannot contribute!

Please spread the word of my fundraiser if you support me, I
would greatly appreciate it!

 

With True Sincerity,

-Sienna Grace

story:
Fair trade, organic socks for cleaner air

Hi Friends,

We are a few creative entrepreneurs trying to live a more conscious and healthier life. We absolutely believe that creative thinking can solve everything. The main point of our brilliant business idea is to connect the fulfillment of a simple, basic human need with the solution of an enormously important, acute world-wide problem.

Our products which will fulfill the simple human need are organic socks made in India. The acute problem that we try to solve is air-pollution. How is that possible? No, your feet won’t smell better. But there will be more trees out there!

Why organic? Well, we all know that wearing organic clothes feels good for the body. In contrast to regular cotton, organic fibers are hypoallergenic. Their advantage is that they are free of chemicals and pollutants. Moreover, we realized that “eco-fashion” has become trendier than ever. Soft, organic cotton clothes like t-shirts, trousers, underwear are getting more and more “in”. We also realized that wearing them means saving money. It’s been proved that organic cotton lasts for more than 100 machine washes before the fibers begin to break apart.

But the beauty of our business idea is that it’s not selfish. We decided to make a step forward: we care not only about the consumer, but ABOUT THE WORLD. The main point is: after each pair of socks sold, we plant a new tree. It’s that simple. So, buying a pair of Karmasocks means the planting of a new tree. This way, wearing our product becomes one of the easiest ways to support the environment. The system will be absolutely transparent and the buyer will be able to easily follow the planting of “his tree”.

Moreover, Karmasocks are made according to the environmental principles of fair trade. This means that our socks are being produced in safe work environments, where responsible trade relations and equal employment opportunities are provided, in order to positively impact communities. It’s known that regular cotton farming involves a huge amount of chemicals that results in an unsafe work environment for employees. One of the greatest benefits of organic clothing is that the growing process of the cotton is nontoxic. This way, a healthy environment for both our employees and locals is guaranteed.

We need your support

We live in a world where even a brilliant idea needs some financial support to become a real business. To get our production started, we would need US$ 4,500.

If you are pro health, pro environment, and you like nice, comfortable socks with a timeless design, don’t let our idea remain only an idea. Let it become reality! Please support us whatever level you're comfortable with. With your help we can soon start producing socks for a healthier life and planting trees for a cleaner air and a better future.

Thank you for your support,

The Karmasocks.com Team

FAQ:

1. Where are our socks made and who makes them?
Our high-quality socks are made in India, by a company which is certified to produce fair trade socks and the only one to use organic cotton.

2. How can I be sure that there will be a tree planted after I buy a pair of your socks?
In cases of such great endeavors it is crucial that we concentrate our powers. Rather than planting the trees ourselves, every Friday we will donate 1 USD for every pair sold for the Plant a Billion Trees Campaign. The Plant a Billion Trees campaign (http://adopt.nature.org/plantabillion/brazil/ ) is an effort to restore 10,100 km2 of land and plant 1 billion trees by 2015 in the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. The campaign was launched in 2008 and is one of the largest tree planting programs in the world. Each donated dollar results in one planted tree in the Atlantic Forest. For those who still worry about the transparency of the whole system: once a year we will be audited and we will publish this on our website, so the audience will be totally able to follow our activity. More

3. OK, but what does organic mean, anyway?
Organic cotton is produced according to the internationally recognized organic farming standards of the EU regulation 834/2007, of the USA National Organic Program (NOP), the Indian National Program for Organic Production (NPOP) or the Japanese Agricultural Standard (JAS). More simply put, organic cotton is produced of non-genetically modified plants, grown without the use of any synthetic agricultural chemicals such as fertilizers or pesticides. Here you can learn more about organic cotton: http://www.organiccotton.org/oc/Organic-cotton/Benefits-of-organic-cotton/Benefits-of-oc.php

4. And what about fair trade? What does this involve in your case? This means that our socks are being produced in safe work environments where workers get a fair salary. NO, our socks are NOT made in sweat shops. The company is certified at the Fairtrade Foundation: http://www.fairtrade.org.uk/what_is_fairtrade/default.aspx

5. Who designs the socks?
In which colors and sizes are they available? Socks are being designed by our in-house designers. We start with plain socks in 4 colors: black, red, green and blue. If we grow, we plan to collaborate with our customers regarding new, fancy designs.

6. If I decide to buy a pair of socks, should I pay for shipping?
Shipping costs are included for USA and Europe.

7. I could buy any kind of socks and then go out and plant a tree by myself! Why is it worth for me to buy YOUR socks?
Yes, you can, and we would be happy if you would also plant a tree yourself. But honestly, how many trees have you planted until now? And how many socks have you bought during your lifetime? Do you see the difference…? If there would have been a company offering what we offer you, there would be at least 100 trees more on Earth, only because of you. Wouldn’t it be beautiful?

story:
This Campaign is now moved to http://igg.me/at/tobemyself3/x/2491263

since it has expired in days. If you are following us, please go to the new page!!!!!!

 

 

 

 

Who am I?

My name is Juliet, or Julz for short. I’m a 38 year old transwoman or male-to-female  transgender individual. As an teen, I wanted so badly to look like women I saw on television and my friends in high school. I hated myself for not having the body that I wanted, for instead having a body that didn’t even feel like mine. As I grew older, I thought I could learn to accept that this was the body I was given and it’s the only one I’m going to get. So no matter what, I’m going to try to make the best of it in any way I can. This didn’t work out as well as I had planned.

My transition

It’s hard to look in the mirror and not recognize the body that you see. It’s depressing  and demoralizing. Thankfully we live in modern times and there are options available for girls like me. I started HRT 2 years ago and the changes have been fantastic. Little by little each day, I move closer to my ideal. I can’t describe how wonderful it is to see myself becoming the woman I have longed to be. But each day, I see my chest, and although there has been minimal growth, knowing that my body is still wrong in a rush of sadness, alienation, and anxiety. So daily I wear padding to mimic full breast and no low cut shirts. This causes me to suffer the side effects of sweat rashes, heat blisters, and daily irritation.

My family, while in the past being supportive of the choices I made, when I came out to them, they didn’t  really support me at all,since then they have made some progress to accepting me for who I am,but not much more, but time will tell the future . My decision to get surgery or any kind of medical intervention involving my gender, was solely on me, so I am financially on my own. I would not be able to afford the hormone treatments if it wasn’t for the care of the VA directive that was released in 2011 covering the treatment of transgendered veterans. Only then was I able to afford the meds needed.I have also been in therapy for some time and can provide the required letter of recommendation, saying that “transgender surgery is the next step in the transition process”, a qualification also provided by the Trans Standards of Care (WPATH).

For me, top surgery represents the biggest joy I can imagine, starting from when I was entering puberty. After years of research, advice, and self-reflection, I’ve made the final decision to pursue top surgery. At the end of the procedure, I will have a well-developed female chest. But the most valuable part of the surgery is that I will finally feel at home in my own body. All I want is to be happy and this is the key to it.

So I am humbly asking for your help and support to make this possible, to make my dream a reality, and bringing me one step closer to being myself.

 

I need your help!

Top surgery is very expensive, especially for a young woman  that has returned to college attempting to make her way in the world. I’m currently a CNA and have applied for the nursing program, but the pay as a CNA is dismal and most of it goes to pay for rent, bills, food, so that I can survive. In this situation, it’s very difficult to find the money to put away for something that will help me thrive.

 

So this is where you thoughtful  folks come in. Here’s the breakdown of surgery costs.

Surgeon fees: $3500

Actual cost of the implants alone(Silicone): $1450

Anesthesia fee: 980

Facility fee(hospital costs): 1546

 

Total for this brings it to ; 7476.00

 

This seems like an insurmountable cost, but no amount is to small or too great. Every donation is a little piece of joy, a smile just for you, knowing I am one step closer to my dream, my one hope, becoming a reality.

Even if you can’t personally contribute,  please pass the word along. Send this to your friends and neighbors and allies. Because this surgery will literally change my life. For the first time, I will be able to feel my body and not feel dysphoria and pain; there will only be joy, happiness, and possibility. And that truly is the greatest gift of all.

 

Questions?


I know some of you might have questions for me before you decide to donate. Its not an easy desicion to donate and have some thought in your head you would like to have answered. So, I am going to give you a way to ask me your question before you donate if you want. You can email me at blazindizzy@juno.com. I will try to respond to your questions in reasonable time.

Again, thank you to all involved!

Again, thank you to all involved!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Pamela. I have been working with Abby’s mother Tricia for three years. I am a friend and their entire family is full of great people too. On September 24th, Tricia found out she will no longer have a job after December, they are eliminating her position. Two days later, results from a biopsy taken on September 21st came in and the doctors wanted them to come in right away. Abby has Acute Myeloid Leukemia, AML, which is a cancer of the blood and bone marrow rarely seen in people under the age of 40. It is also a rapidly progressing cancer so upon detection, immediate chemotherapy is necessary for any chance of success. They started that night and have been going ever since and I know from experience, that is a scary way to begin cancer treatments. The treatments for this leukemia often stretch for years because it has a high relapse rate. Stretching the treatments out helps lower the chances of relapse. But, this means many 3 weeks stays in the hospital and away from home because this is an inpatient procedure.

I felt compelled to begin this campaign because Abby is such a special little girl and because Tricia is a good friend. My husband died from cancer just over a year ago so I am very aware of what they are going through and what they may face. And with Tricia about to lose her job, this family needs a miracle and I hope we, you and me, and give it to them! Every dollar given, every link forwarded allows Abby’s parents to focus on HER and not how they are going to pay the bills, as it should be.

What We Need & What You Get

We have set a modest goal but in all honesty, this is going to be a marathon and will go on for years. Hopefully Tricia can get another job soon but this is hardly the optimal time to be looking for work, even with a healthy family. Every single dollar we raise will go to Abby's care and keeping her life stable so she can use her energy to fight this battle. It will also allow the people she wants around her the most, her parents, to be there for her, day and night. A hospital is no place for a young child to be without parents.

Please look for updates regarding Perks. We will putting together some ideas and hope to have more cool things for you guys in the future. I wanted to get this started right away. If you have any questions, my email is at the bottom of this page.

The Impact

Your impact will be huge and immediate. This family is going through so much right now, as many of us are, but having such a serious disease to deal with is extra tough. Just knowing that there are a bunch of people out here in the world working to raise funds so they can be free to concentrate on the most important thing in their life is a huge weight off their shoulders.

When my husband and I found out he had Stage 4 esophageal cancer two years ago, we did not know this tool existed. When he passed away 18 months after diagnosis, the bills were huge and he left little. Every little bit helps, I promise!! This is such a great way to help people and make a HUGE difference in their life without a huge sacrifice from ourselves. Please, help me help them keep their focus where it needs to be, on Abby and getting her better.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, please consider spreading the word about Abby's campaign. Facebook, twitter, blogs, and email are all great ways to share with your friends! 

If you have any questions or comments, please feel free to contact me. I'd love to talk with you! pamelarvt@gmail.com

story:
What is Tiles for America?

Answer:  Tiles for America is NYC's first spontaneous, living 9/11 Memorial created by the people the day after the tragic events of 9/11.

 “Thousands of tiles reflecting [the voices of] patriotism, heroes, courage, unity, poetry and other positive themes arrived in NYC and were hung on the chain-link fence at Mulry Square [spawning a one-of-a-kind visual message of unity and cooperation]. They continue to arrive.” 

The Memorial is located in the heart of the West Village at the corner of Greenwich Avenue and 7th Avenue South and has been featured in television shows, movies, and music videos. The tiles hang on a rusted, chain-link fence surrounding property owned by NYC’s MTA.

Special Thanks to the Comtemporary Ceramic Studios Association (CCSA), their member studios, and countless others, the Memorial continued to grow, change, and flourish,  attracting countless NYers and tourist.

 

A CALL TO ACTION IS REQUIRED: Tiles for America faces the imminent danger of extinction!  These tiny voices will no longer be heard.

The MTA hosts the Memorial site and has been gracious enough to allow the Memorial to exist since its inception.  Plans have been announced to build a ventilation station where the Memorial is located. Since the removal of the fence is needed to commence the construction, the Memorial must come down by October 1, 2012.  

Make your contribute to American History, now! Save Tiles for America by giving to the Tiles for America Preservation Project, with pledges starting at $9.11.

 

Tiles for America Preservation Society: Since the Memorial's inception, local residents have expended their personal time and money to maintain Tiles for America and the Memorial location. These residents have unified their voices by establishing Tiles for America Preservation Society, whose responsibility is to address all concerns pertaining to Tiles for America.  

Tiles for America Preservation Project: To date there has never been a grant issued or any public monies given on behalf of Tiles for America. In response to the lack of public funding, the Society has established the Tiles for America Preservation Project.  The Preservation Project is a community intitiative focused on raising financial resources urgently needed to support the start-up cost of removing, restoring, preserving and exhibiting Tiles for America.

 

Using the 9/11 formula!

There are five pledge levels and perks for you at each level as you participate.  We encourage you to use the tools on this site and all social media outlets to promote this campaign.  

Millions from around the world have viewed this memorial and heard the voices represented by each tile and been inspired by the countless messages of love, hope, partiotism with the promise of a new day.  

"People decided to put up an unauthorized memorial, and it was more meaningful [than an official memorial]," he said. "It wasn't a city memorial, it was a people [‘s] memorial." - Angelo Rizza, NY1, 09/3/11

Your generous pledge of support helps to assure these voices will continue to be heard  and millions more will benefit from this unrealized nation treasure for generation to come.

story:
Hello all, my name is Fraser and I am writing a campaign to support  my wonderful girlfriend and family who are in need of our help.

Her name is Seyran "Sarah" Cinar, we’ve been going out for over a year now and in the past 7 months. Sarah has been experiencing some horrible conditions, severe asthma and stomach problems which doctors have not been able to specifically diagnose. These cause Sarah to be admitted into hospital and ICU for long durations which affect her university studies. Due to living in a small town she regularly is required to travel long distances to see specialists.

This campaign is important to me because I wish to see my girlfriend living a better life and in less pain. If I could even raise the smallest of funds I know it would help her and her family pay for some of her medication and doctor and specialist visits outside of town. Her parents are consistently taking time off work to take care of her and had to leave one of their jobs to take care of her during the day, I also do this on a regular basis to assist her.

The funding raised would contribute towards her medication as she is on 13 different medications, the ones I am aware of are, Ventolin, Symbicort, Alvesco, Attrovent, Seretide, Prednisolone, Nexium, Buscopan, Tramadole and has brought two nebulisers, one which she is required to take with her everywhere she goes. The reason she is on so many preventer puffers is due to her specialist suggesting she takes an aggressive approach to prevent the asthma attacks.

The steroids Sarah takes for her asthma have been suggested by the doctors to have an impact on her stomach. The doctors are yet to figure out what is wrong with her stomach, Sarah has had a gastroscopy and many other tests to determine what the problem was but nothing has been determined as of yet.

The medical staff in our area have been wonderful, but they cannot do much other than temporarily treat her asthma attacks. This is why I am trying to raise funds, she is only 19 years old and I wish she didn’t have to go through all these problems.  I would love it if you shared this with all your friends and family. Please help me help her.

May God bless you all and thank you for taking your time to read this.

story:
I am a victim of a serious crime that has happened to me. I am an inventor, that is a victim of Illegal Implantation that is in need of removal of an Illegally implanted device. This device is  designed to track a person while in the privacy of thier private life. I have been threatned to either hand over my inventions or I will be killed for them, "truth".

   Well I am telling the truth and have more evidence then any other victim of this same crime. I am famous for speaking out against this crime and winning cases in court for this same crime. If one is to just google my name they can find my cases online. I have been published in many magazines as well as newspapers sold around the world. The most recent coverage of my case is printed in over 35,000 copies being sold on the newstand of Fortean Time issue number 243 2011. Just to check the validity of my claims to you, please do read this article to confirm. It's legit!  http://www.forteantimes.com/features/fbi/5383/a_game_of_tag.html   

  This is real and its expensive to get removed! I have been pumping out thousands to just protect my inventions as well as my family from this crime. As, you will see in the video as well as this article above, I am currently trying to stop this crime against myself and others. I have spoke out in Washignton DC against this crime and have also been the driving force for laws to be implemented against this same crime that I am a victim of. So, Please take the time to go over these House Bill's as well as the Senate Bill's too to validate the concern, as well as what I am speaking of.As, to the truth!

  So, if you can please help me out it would greatly appreciated, I would love to just get on with my inventing and life.

 Here are just a few professionals that are currently advocating for my case. Please goolge these professional as well to check for the "truth"

 

Politician David Larson, Elected Official to the County of San  Bernardino California .

Politician The Congressional Member Todd Tiahrt

Medical Professional, Dr John Hall MD.

Clinical Psychologist. MA. Cathy Meadows

 

 Here is a current law in Calf. If this is NOT REAL then why the laws against it?

 

New California Law Forbids Forced RFID Implantation in Humans

John Kuzin 
November 2007 | Privacy In Focus 

California has enacted a statute prohibiting the compelled or coerced implantation of a subdermal identification device, such as a Radio Frequency Identification (RFID) microchip or a newer chipless "RFID tattoo." The new law does not impact voluntary implantation. California now joins Wisconsin and North Dakota as states that have banned forced RFID implantation. Florida is among several states considering a similar law. 

The new California statute (SB No. 362, now Chapter 538) was approved by Governor Schwarzenegger on October 12. It establishes a new Civil Code Section 52.7, which provides that "no person shall require, coerce, or compel any other individual to undergo the subcutaneous implanting of an identification device." It creates a civil action under which a person implanted may recover a "civil penalty" of no more than $10,000 per implant and no more than $1,000 "for each day the violation continues," actual damages and compensatory damages, as well as injunctive relief. Punitive damages may be awarded on proof of the defendant's "malice, oppression, fraud or duress" in requiring device implantation. This statute becomes effective on January 1, 2008. 

Why the Statute Believed Needed
Recent RFID technology advances in microchip miniaturization have resulted in the development of hundreds of new RFID-enabled products, including devices designed to identify, track and monitor people. The sponsor of the California law, State Senator Joe Simitian (D-Palo Alto), introduced the bill after learning that a Cincinnati surveillance company, Citywatcher.com, had required employees who work in its secure data center to have an RFID chip implanted in an arm. 
In 2004, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved VeriChip Corporation's use of an RFID tag for human implantation to allow medical professionals to access a patient's medical history in case of an emergency. The VeriChip device is an ultra-small glass-encapsulated RFID tag (about the size of a grain of rice) that is injected beneath the skin. According to VeriChip, more than 2,000 people have had its RFID tag implanted. 

VeriChip Corporation, which went public in February of this year, addressed how unresolved privacy issues could impact its business in its February 9, 2007, prospectus filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission: "While we support all pending and enacted legislation that would preclude anything other than voluntary implantation, legislative bodies or government agencies may determine to go further, and their actions may have the effect, directly or indirectly, of delaying, limiting or preventing the use of human-implantable RFID microchips or the sale, manufacture or use of RFID systems utilizing such microchips." 

A December 2006 Department of Homeland Security privacy committee report noted that efficiencies from RFID-enabled identification documents are limited because staff still need some means of confirming that the document holders are who they say they are. This problem could be addressed with subdermal implantation of RFID devices. While subdermal RFID has some promise when used voluntarily, it comes with the same security and privacy risks associated with other RFID-enabled products. Because it is injected beneath the skin and is costly and challenging to remove safely, subdermal RFID presents a Pandora's Box of policy questions in addition to its implications for constitutionally protected rights to freedom and privacy. 

Pending before the California legislature are several other bills, also introduced by Senator Simitian, that are aimed at addressing privacy concerns of RFID use in school identification documents, driver's licenses and similar personal documents.
