story:
Short Summary

The bus ride from Mendocino to Santa Clara cost $2300  for both the JV and Varsity teams.  30 % of our team on scholarship and can't afford the $60.00 to join the team.  We are supported by the Sheriff's Activity League of Mendocino County.

The Sheriffs help support our team because they believe the best way to keep kids out of trouble and off the streets is to keep them active in team sports.  One of our coaches Bruce Ricketts was a coach for Desmond Bishop, the linebacker for the Green Bay Packers.  We our hoping that our committment to our team and exposing the players to a world class team like the 49ers will give them a goal to set their sights on.  We have already been approved to attend the camp, now we are fundraising so we can rent a charter bus to take us to the camp.

All of our board members are volunteers and no one is ever compensated for their hours of committment to our team.

Thank you for any help that you can provide us.  We really appreciate it.

Submitted by the President of the team, Christine Kenton-Braden

story:
Harel Dabush, from Beer Sheva is only 5 years old and is faced with a life-threatening rare cancer. Now Harel needs special testing and treatment in the United States, but does not have enough money to pay for it. 
Two and a half years ago was when the family discovered that Harel had a rare cancer, called Neuroblastoma. Slowly the tumor has spread to bones throughout the body and most recently the skull and chest. He received numerous chemotherapy, radiotherapy, bone marrow transplantation, and German experimental treatment that did not help. He had a bone marrow transplant, and harsh treatments, but the disease continued to strike.
His father and mother find it difficult to finance Harel's treatments alone putting the entire family through severe economic hardship. The father was forced to quit his job to bring Harel to the US. The working mother also takes care of the couple’s 2 year old daughter and is 9 months pregnant with their third child. 
As a result of tests conducted, it was discovered that Harel’s body has become resistant to standard chemotherapy. The only chance to save Harel is with an experimental treatment performed at Children's Hospital Of Philadelphia. The cost plus payments for tests and stay, could reach $600,000 - an amount that the HMO is not going to pay and his parents cannot afford. $300,000 has been raised so far in order for Harel to start treatment and cover all expenses, but $300,000 is still needed.
Harel and his father arrived last week but unfortunately Harel’s mother was unable to make the journey as she is due any day. A local Cherry Hill, NJ family has selflessly opened up their home to Harel and his father during the three-month trial. G-d willing if Harel’s body responds well to the treatment, the family will be spending a year here.
Any donation big or small will help save Harel’s life. Harel needs your help. 


Please contact Danielle Schwartz (609-674-1461 or dani.kimchi@gmail.com) if you are interested in helping Harel.

הראל יוסף דבוש, רק בן 5 וכבר הספיק לעבור את מחצית חייו בבתי חולים. בגיל שנתיים וחצי לקה הראל בסרטן נדיר מאוד מסוג נוירובלסטמה. 
מאז גילוי המחלה עבר הראל טיפוליים כימותרפיים, השתלת מוח עצם, ניתוח להסרת גידולים אותם ניתן היה להסיר וגם טיפול ניסיוני בגרמניה שגם לא עזר.
הרופאים בבית החולים שניידר שבפתח תקווה המליצו להוריו של הראל להטיסו לפילדלפיה, לבית החולים לילדים Chop, שם ניתן טיפול ייחודי וראשון מסוגו בעולם לזן נדיר זה של המחלה. טיפול זה הוא הסיכוי היחיד להצלת חייו של הראל דבוש. עלות הטיפול נאמדת בכ-400 אלף דולרים, סכום אותו המשפחה לא יכולה להשיג.
העיר באר- שבע, בה מתגוררים המשפחה, לקחה את הראל הקטן תחת חסותה וקיימה לאחרונה ערב התרמה מיוחד בהשתתפות אמנים רבים: אייל שני, צביקה הדר, שלום אסייג, הראל מויאל, רוני דלומי ועוד. בערב זה גויס סכום של כ-300 אלף דולרים אך עדיין חסרים יותר מ-100 אלף דולרים להשלמת התהליך.
חייהם של בני המשפחה השתנו לחלוטין בעקבות מחלתו של הראל. האם, אביגיל, הנמצאת כעת בחודש התשיעי להריון, עובדת בשירות בתי הסוהר. בעלה שי, עובד בלילות כנהג משאית. וכך במשך הימים בהם היה הראל בטיפולים חילקו בני הזוג משמרות בניהם, האב בבקרים והאם אחרי הצהריים. להראל יש אחות נוספת, ליאור, בת השנתיים.
הראל הגיע לארה"ב יחד עם אביו שי ב-12 לפברואר. וכעת הם מתגוררים אצל משפחה ישראלית בצ'רי- היל, ניו ג'רזי.  
הראל ואביו ישהו אצל המשפחה המארחת למשך כשלושה חודשים לתקופה הראשונה. במידה והראל יגיב לטיפולים באופן חיובי, הם ישארו בארה"ב להמשך הטיפולים שיארכו כשנה.
האם אביגל אמרה כי היא מתכוונת לטוס מייד לאחר הלידה יחד עם ביתה והתינוק, לארה"ב ולהצטרף להראל ולשי בעלה.
האב שי מספר כי "הראל הוא ילד רגיל כמו כולם אך הילדות נלקחה ממנו, הראל מודע לעצם היותו חולה, לצערנו המשחקים שהוא מכיר זה רופא וחולה והצעצועים שלו הם התרופות"
עוד הוסיף האב שלאחרונה הראל התחיל להתפלל והוא מבקש בלילה במיטה מבורא עולם להיות בריא!
בימים אלה המשפחה עדיין מגייסת כסף עבור הטיפולים היקרים אותם התחיל כאמור בבית החולים לילדים בפילדלפיה. טיפולים העשויים להציל את חייו ולהגשים את חלומותיו: להכיר את אחיו שבבטן אימו, ללמוד כמו כולם בכיתה א' בשנה הבאה וכמובן- לחיות!
story_txt:
Harel Dabush, from Beer Sheva is only 5 years old and is faced with a life-threatening rare cancer. Now Harel needs special testing and treatment in the United States, but does not have enough money to pay for it.  Two and a half years ago was when the family discovered that Harel had a rare cancer, called Neuroblastoma. Slowly the tumor has spread to bones throughout the body and most recently the skull and chest. He received numerous chemotherapy, radiotherapy, bone marrow transplantation, and German experimental treatment that did not help. He had a bone marrow transplant, and harsh treatments, but the disease continued to strike. His father and mother find it difficult to finance Harel's treatments alone putting the entire family through severe economic hardship. The father was forced to quit his job to bring Harel to the US. The working mother also takes care of the couple’s 2 year old daughter and is 9 months pregnant with their third child.  As a result of tests conducted, it was discovered that Harel’s body has become resistant to standard chemotherapy. The only chance to save Harel is with an experimental treatment performed at Children's Hospital Of Philadelphia. The cost plus payments for tests and stay, could reach $600,000 - an amount that the HMO is not going to pay and his parents cannot afford. $300,000 has been raised so far in order for Harel to start treatment and cover all expenses, but $300,000 is still needed. Harel and his father arrived last week but unfortunately Harel’s mother was unable to make the journey as she is due any day. A local Cherry Hill, NJ family has selflessly opened up their home to Harel and his father during the three-month trial. G-d willing if Harel’s body responds well to the treatment, the family will be spending a year here. Any donation big or small will help save Harel’s life. Harel needs your help. 
 Please contact Danielle Schwartz (609-674-1461 or dani.kimchi@gmail.com) if you are interested in helping Harel.
הראל יוסף דבוש, רק בן 5 וכבר הספיק לעבור את מחצית חייו בבתי חולים. בגיל שנתיים וחצי לקה הראל בסרטן נדיר מאוד מסוג נוירובלסטמה. 
מאז גילוי המחלה עבר הראל טיפוליים כימותרפיים, השתלת מוח עצם, ניתוח להסרת גידולים אותם ניתן היה להסיר וגם טיפול ניסיוני בגרמניה שגם לא עזר.
הרופאים בבית החולים שניידר שבפתח תקווה המליצו להוריו של הראל להטיסו לפילדלפיה, לבית החולים לילדים Chop, שם ניתן טיפול ייחודי וראשון מסוגו בעולם לזן נדיר זה של המחלה. טיפול זה הוא הסיכוי היחיד להצלת חייו של הראל דבוש. עלות הטיפול נאמדת בכ-400 אלף דולרים, סכום אותו המשפחה לא יכולה להשיג.
העיר באר- שבע, בה מתגוררים המשפחה, לקחה את הראל הקטן תחת חסותה וקיימה לאחרונה ערב התרמה מיוחד בהשתתפות אמנים רבים: אייל שני, צביקה הדר, שלום אסייג, הראל מויאל, רוני דלומי ועוד. בערב זה גויס סכום של כ-300 אלף דולרים אך עדיין חסרים יותר מ-100 אלף דולרים להשלמת התהליך.

story:
Our Story

On August 17th, 2011 Katie McCall, a CA licensed midwife, was convicted of practicing medicine without a license for a 2007 birth she assisted as a midwifery student. She was arrested, charged, tried and convicted while holding her medical license in good standing and while having no complaints issued against her as a licensed professional. She has never lost a baby or harmed anyone while serving the over 1,000 birthing families she has served in midwifery care and education over the past ten years. She has never had a complaint filed by a family she has cared for. 
 
Her criminal charge arose from a home birth where her supervising midwife could not arrive because she was at another birth. Instead of leaving the family to birth unassisted, Katie stayed.  She recommended that the family transfer to the hospital and the family refused.  They were aware that she was only a student midwife and that she was unable to secure an overseeing midwife. The original complaint was made by a bystander and not by the family who chose to birth at home.

 

When the mother began to push, the baby got stuck in a condition called shoulder dystocia.  Using her training as a student, Katie performed the Gaskin maneuver to free the baby.  The maneuver was successful, however, the mother began to hemorrhage due to a partially retained placenta.  Again, using her training, Katie was able to stop the bleeding and protect the mother from harm.  She went on to get her license and was later arrested from her licensed midwife office and taken to jail. At trial, Katie argued through counsel that her practicing medicine was justified due to the emergency situations above. 

 

In most every state that recognizes out of hospital midwifery, Katie would not have been charged for refusing to abandon a woman who was birthing that refused a transport. But the state of California's legislation makes something as simple as palpating a pregnant belly or taking a blood pressure a felony.

 

Despite expert testimony from the Assistant Director of the Emergency Department at UCLA-Santa Monica and a renowned OB/GYN that Katie’s actions potentially saved two lives, a jury convicted her of one felony count of practicing medicine without a license at trial. Hundreds of letters were written in defense of Katie and the judge remarked that he had never seen so many people show support to a convicted criminal in his court room.

 

The Impact

On September 16, 2011, despite the fact that Katie has no prior criminal record of any sort, the judge upheld the felony conviction and sentenced Katie to 3 years probation and told her she cannot work as a midwife during that time. She was not given any time in prison or jail, but was instead given 280 hours of community service and $10,000 in restitution to the CA Medical Board, which was down from the $45,000 they were asking for to reimburse them for their investigation costs. This amount shocked even the judge, especially since the one birth was the only birth Katie was being tried for and the state of California is in such dire economic straits. Katie is unable to work in her profession during probation and the medical board will revoke her license as a result of the conviction. This is causing untold financial hardship on Katie, a single mother, and her two children, Christiana and Robert. She may never be allowed to be a midwife in CA again.

 

For further information, please take a moment to read what the media has had to say: http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/09/16/los-an... 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to see Katie able to serve families by doing what she loves once again. She is currently cleaning toilets at a shelter on Skid Row for her community service. As one of her supporters, Colby Scott, recently said, "I think she served the community much better as a midwife." In order for Katie to be able to move out of the state of California and be able to practice in a more midwifery friendly area, she must first be off probation since one of her probation requirements is that she not work as a midwife. In order to get off of probation, she needs to raise $10,000 to pay the Medical Board's restitution while simultaneously losing her job. So far, Katie's supporters have selflessly raised $4,000! This leaves $6,000 left to raise.

 

Please consider contribuing toward this campaign. Katie's children have put together a video and several levels of gifts/perks for your contributions. Let's join Katie's example of self sacrifice with gratitude.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially right now, you can still help! Below are three easy ways:

 

1. Make sure to pass this page on to friends, family, co-workers, political representatives, church or synagogue members, women's clubs, neighbors, facebook, twitter, bloggers etc.

 

2. Follow Katie as she blogs about doing her community service on Skid Row (http://supportmidwifekatiemccall.wordpress.com/)

 

3. If you live in California, please consider becoming a member of The California Association of Midwives (http://www.californiamidwives.org/), which consists of borth midwives and consumers. They are currently working on drafting a bill to address the outdated nature and problems with the current student midwifery laws.

 

THANK YOU!

story:
Our Story

Lets help our active duty military,  families, and veterans reach the healthy lifestyle they deserve. Many are coming back from war and service with little knowledge of the vast integrative medicine and holistic approaches available to them. Many do not want or need excessive medication but can use to support with stress, fatigue, insomnia, marital problems, and grief. I am passionate about helping those who served our beautiful country. As a military counselor for four years I served on many bases in the USA, Europe, South Korea, and the Pacific.  When I left I was motivated to offer the best resources available to them. This book is a tool not a textbook. It contains many online references and  suggests good remedies to serve body,mind and spirit.  Please help me  publish this book so it can be distributed to distant bases, active duty, wives, veterans, and extended family members. 

In this book:  
Healing The Heart Of A Warrior by Joyce L Graham,MS,LPC,CHom
A Holistic Approach to Health

Warrior Tool For Self Assessment 
Warrior Stories
Warrior Heart
Warrior Relationships
Warrior Mind: PTSD, Insomnia, Fatigue, Stress
Tool Kit for Wellness: holistic, natural remedies to help from herbs, homeopathy, aromatherapy, teas and nutrition.
Circle Of Care 
     


The Impact

Stressful situations such as deployments and reintegration, marital stress, and isolation from family members can seriously compromise your overall health and wellness. Doing PT at 6 am is great but for long term success you need other resources and directives to take charge of your own healing and well being. Try the appropriate  recommendations in this new book and discover what can help you. It contains good online resources and suggestions for integrative medical care. Eating properly is difficult especially when you are out in the desert on a  mission. The suggested supplements can help your body find the balance it needs. 

Healing The Heart Of A Warrior contains:

* Remedies for insomnia, stress and anxiety
* Fictionalized stories of grief and loss
* Healing theatre trauma
* Warrior self assessment tools for identifying personal problems
* Personal relationship problems ans solutions 
* A Warrior "Tool Kit" also helpful for family members and friends:     
      practical and useful

If we do not make all the money we asked for then we will scale back our marketing efforts and efforts to give books to library's and non-profits.  We will not be able to distribute in quantities to the bases as planned. It will be a much scaled back approach and we will not reach as many people as we hoped to. 
I will still be able to publish this book without the entire funding met. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are passionate about reaching our goal to help in the following areas: 

  1. editing 
  2. hiring  social media marketing and public relations
  3. graphic design and interior design of the book
  4. ebook formation and marketing 
  5. hiring a distributor
  6. sending free copies of the book to base library's in the USA

I have money in savings but not enough to do all the things I want to market globally and reach a big market. Not having a big publishing house behind me limits my access that I might otherwise have.

Building my web site presence and platform is crucial and the money would help me to hire a good web designer and then market through the website. 

Any other ideas for giving back I am open to considering as well. 
You mat share these ideas and they will be considered!!!


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by sharing the campaign on your social media: Facebook, Twitter, Google +, LinkedIn or your personal email list. Whatever way serves you best to help us. 

There is a share tool on this site and you can use it as much as you like to help out. Once a week come back and share it. All your help is very much appreciated!!!  Thank you. We are grateful. 

This is a great book from an author whose joy and passion in helping shines through! Quite simply, she cares.

story:
Short Summary

When I first met Leanne, it did not take me long to realize she was someone very special. She is very kind and tender-hearted and genuinely cares about people. She has donated her time in the past to help raise funds to benefit cancer victims and is constantly thinking of others. She is a selfless person and what brings her the most joy is doing kind and considerate things for others. She has shown her compassion for others over and over again. 

Please help to cover Cobra medical coverage. Medical coverage for 12 months is $5,616 ($468/month). Leanne suffers from Rheumatoid Arthritis, a chronic autoimmune disease where the immune system attacks itself. In RA, the immune system – which is designed to protect our health by attacking foreign cells such as viruses and bacteria – instead attacks the body’s own tissues, specifically the joints. Left untreated, RA can cause deformity and disability, in addition to extreme pain and discomfort. She also suffers from migraine headaches and an under-active thyroid. Leanne has always put others before herself and has a heart of gold. She volunteered for the American Red Cross and spent weeks in Mississippi after Hurricane Katrina to assist in the recovery and rebuilding efforts.  Recently, she has endured some very difficult times. She is not working currently and is uninsured at this time. She takes over ten different prescription medications daily to control her disease and help reduce the pain/inflammation that her RA causes, in addition to other medical conditions. She has undergone several medical procedures, including sinus surgery, multiple EGD’s for gastrointestinal disorders, trips to the ER for debilitating migraine headaches and struggles with frequent infections.  She must see a specialist and undergo lab testing on a regular basis for Rheumatoid Arthritis. Her immune system is weak and she is susceptible to frequent infections and illnesses. Due to her condition, Leanne has difficulty performing some simple tasks that most of us take for granted. This campaign is my effort to give something back in appreciation for all that she has done for others. She is certainly deserving and she is sincerely grateful for anything you can do to help.

What We Need & What You Get

ANY AMOUNT COUNTS!! EVERY DOLLAR IS APPRECIATED!!

We are seeking compassionate and caring people to donate funds to help with immediate expenses. Any monetary amount, no matter how large or small, is greatly appreciated.  It is imperative that she maintains daily treatment for her disease to prevent further joint damage and destruction. She is being forced to move from her home where she has resided for 13 years due to her current financial situation. Pease look into your hearts and support this campaign to help give Leanne the quality of life she deserves and the medical attention she needs.  

The Impact

The funds raised will go directly towards Leanne's immediate needs for medical care and medication. Leanne has always taken pride in taking care of herself and her financial responsibilities. Due to circumstances beyond her control, she is facing harder times ahead and really needs help from those in better circumstances. Your help will also bring her peace of mind as she spends a lot of time worrying and is uncertain of the future.  We are so grateful for this funding platform and greatly appreciative of any help you can offer! Please consider Paying it Forward for a very worthy cause. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about this campaign! We ask that you share with your family, friends and link this story on your Facebook or Twitter pages. At this time, there is no cure for RA. It's important that people become educated and informed about this disease. It is estimated that 1.5 million people in the US suffer from Rheumatoid Arthritis. If you are unable to donate at this time, please stop and say a prayer for Leanne and PLEASE consider sharing this information with everyone you know.  

For questions about this campaign, please email: Michic40@gmail.com 

Note: We hope to raise at least $3,000 so that Leanne can keep 96% of campaign funds but we hope to raise more. Thank-you for your kindness, compassion and helping to make a difference in one persons life! 

With love and heartfelt thanks!
story_txt:
Short Summary
When I first met Leanne, it did not take me long to realize she was someone very special. She is very kind and tender-hearted and genuinely cares about people. She has donated her time in the past to help raise funds to benefit cancer victims and is constantly thinking of others. She is a selfless person and what brings her the most joy is doing kind and considerate things for others. She has shown her compassion for others over and over again. 
Please help to cover Cobra medical coverage. Medical coverage for 12 months is $5,616 ($468/month). Leanne suffers from Rheumatoid Arthritis, a chronic autoimmune disease where the immune system attacks itself. In RA, the immune system – which is designed to protect our health by attacking foreign cells such as viruses and bacteria – instead attacks the body’s own tissues, specifically the joints. Left untreated, RA can cause deformity and disability, in addition to extreme pain and discomfort. She also suffers from migraine headaches and an under-active thyroid. Leanne has always put others before herself and has a heart of gold. She volunteered for the American Red Cross and spent weeks in Mississippi after Hurricane Katrina to assist in the recovery and rebuilding efforts.  Recently, she has endured some very difficult times. She is not working currently and is uninsured at this time. She takes over ten different prescription medications daily to control her disease and help reduce the pain/inflammation that her RA causes, in addition to other medical conditions. She has undergone several medical procedures, including sinus surgery, multiple EGD’s for gastrointestinal disorders, trips to the ER for debilitating migraine headaches and struggles with frequent infections.  She must see a specialist and undergo lab testing on a regular basis for Rheumatoid Arthritis. Her immune system is weak and she is susceptible to frequent infections and illnesses. Due to her condition, Leanne has difficulty performing some simple tasks that most of us take for granted. This campaign is my effort to give something back in appreciation for all that she has done for others. She is certainly deserving and she is sincerely grateful for anything you can do to help.
What We Need & What You Get
ANY AMOUNT COUNTS!! EVERY DOLLAR IS APPRECIATED!!
We are seeking compassionate and caring people to donate funds to help with immediate expenses. Any monetary amount, no matter how large or small, is greatly appreciated.  It is imperative that she maintains daily treatment for her disease to prevent further joint damage and destruction. She is being forced to move from her home where she has resided for 13 years due to her current financial situation. Pease look into your hearts and support this campaign to help give Leanne the quality of life she deserves and the medical attention she needs.  
The Impact
The funds raised will go directly towards Leanne's immediate needs for medical care and medication. Leanne has always taken pride in taking care of herself and her financial responsibilities. Due to circumstances beyond her control, she is facing harder times ahead and really needs help from those in better circumstances. Your help will also bring her peace of mind as she spends a lot of time worrying and is uncertain of the future.  We are so grateful for this funding platform and greatly appreciative of any help you can offer! Please consider Paying it Forward for a very worthy cause. 
Other Ways You Can Help

It's important that people become educated and informed about this disease. It is estimated that 1.5 million people in the US suffer from Rheumatoid Arthritis. If you are unable to donate at this time, please stop and say a prayer for Leanne and PLEASE consider sharing this information with everyone you know.

With love and heartfelt thanks!

story:
Stretch Goal: $17,000

When your support bumps us up to $17,000, we are going to donate 10 cases of Bump Water to the US Navy's Project Handclasp and every contributor will receive 10% off coupons (via email in November).

 

Sip your way to a healthy baby with all natural, delicious Bump Water.  Healthy babies start with healthy women.  Before you even have a baby in your arms or a bump in your belly, folic acid works hard to give your baby the best start possible.  Getting enough folic acid is critical to healthy development and this bottle-for-your-bump is full of it.  So take a sip and a big sigh of relief; we've got your folic acid—and a bunch of other baby-nourishing vitamins—covered.


Why Bump Water?

Because healthy babies start with healthy women.

With Bump Water, we have the supplement you need—and a great tasting refreshing beverage all in one slim bottle.

The star of prenatals is folic acid—it is essential to the healthy development of children, before (all women of child bearing age should be taking folic acid) and during pregnancy (it dramatically decreases the incidence of neural tube defects) and while breastfeeding. Plus, recent studies are finding there may be a link between folic acid deficiency in mothers and autism.

And as health-conscious moms ourselves, we made sure we watched the calorie and sugar content, and yes, we are all natural. Full calorie versions (weighing in between 90-100 calories) are sweetened—lightly that is—with organic cane sugar, and we have 10-calorie options thanks to stevia. 

We are taking vitamin enhanced to a whole other level.


Our flavors:  It was a tough decision, but here they are!


Flat Options



Sparkling Options

Who We Are

"Isn't there an easier way to get prenatal vitamins other than these huge horse pills that make us sick?"

That was the question that started it all and set four friends—one mom, one mom-to-be, plus two husbands (who met while flying helicopters in the Navy)—on one mission.

Working with beverage experts, we—Amber, Stacy, Spencer and Jon—sipped, sampled and shared with friends in our Brooklyn apartments until we found the perfect combinations of light, delicious flavors, that we have named Bump Water.  We've perfected flat and sparkling versions—because what pregnant woman doesn't crave bubbles?—that are all natural, low in sugar and calories, chock full of the necessary prenatal vitamins, light in taste, and most importantly, refreshing.


Why We Need You

We've poured our savings into developing this unique and groundbreaking beverage brand.  Now we need your help to begin distributing Bump Water.  Your contributions will go towards funding our initial production run.

Your help will allow us to move from development to distribution by allowing us to purchase the necessary materials, including bottles and labels, to package Bump Water.  We're not on a mission to change the world, just make it a little easier to get the nutrition women need to keep them and their baby healthy and happy.  


Other Ways You Can Help

"It takes a village to raise a child."  Bump Water is our baby and we need your help.  Please help us spread the word and make some noise about Bump Water! 

What you can do if you are just as "goo goo gah gah" about Bump Water as we are:

  • Use social media (i.e. twitter, facebook, pinterest, instagram) to raise product awareness. 
  • Tell all your friends about us!
  • Order Bump Water on our website and look for it at a store near you.


From our homes to yours, thank you for your support!  We hope you are as excited as we are about Bump Water.

Tell all your friends about us!
Order Bump Water on our website and look for it at a store near you.


From our homes to yours, thank you for your support!  We hope you are as excited as we are about Bump Water.

story:
Fix-in My Melon

I have this thing call Plagiocephaly. It might sound complicated but  literally means oblique head. It's called a parallelogram deformity because if you look down on the top of my head (bird's-eye-view), it looks as if half of my head has been pushed forward, often accompanied by misalignment of the  ears, facial asymmetry and a bulging forehead.

Melon fixer AKA (DOC Helmet)

Basically, the DOC helmet reshapes my head by capturing my brain growth. To capture the growth, the DOC helmet applies mild holding pressure such as my high forehead, bumps above the ears, bulging on one side of the head, etc and encourages growth in the flattened areas of my head.

Please help me get my head on track!

Any donation amount helps, Because with your help my head can be round like yours!

story:
The Story of Stefanos:

Please view the video with care and understanding of my son's character. Stefanos' PANDAS/PANS condition is not typical of all PANDAS/PANS cases. And yet another reason why we are reaching out.


Stefanos, our son, is a fifteen year old boy who was diagnosed with PANDAS-like (Pediatric Autoimmune Neuro-psych Disorder Associated with Streptococcus) syndrome when he was twelve. Prior to his diagnosis, he was a perfectly normal kid in every way. He was an honors student with a talent in computer programming who was outgoing, funny, loving, and sweet. By Sept 2009, after a Streptococcus infection in June 2009 and a Coxsackie infection a month later, he could not add, read or write and was hallucinating on a daily basis.  He also was experiencing severe movement disorders.

Dr. Rosario Trifiletti, a specialized neurologist in Ramsey, New Jersey said Stefanos’ diagnosis was closest to PANDAS, but that this case was quite special.  He also looked into other forms of autoimmune encephalitis including anti NMDA receptor encephalitis

Although we tried every category of drugs for two years, Stefanos’ hallucinations, movement disorders, anxiety and OCD worsened.  His hallucinations became more violent and terrifying. He heard voices telling him to kill himself. Some days Stefanos could not even walk because his brain could not find his legs.  Some days he could not speak and some days his head would be tilted and attached to his shoulder while his arms waved around uncontrollably. One time Stefanos did not know who he was or where he was, total amnesia, yet he recuperated. We began to call these drastic events episodes. Yet, those years, Stefanos still persevered and went to school and kept his friends.

February 2012, Stefanos started saying nasty things.  He would speak about every horror movie ever made.  His life revolved around darkness for at least fifteen hours of the day.  He exhibited non-stop talking and pacing.  I turned to Father Eugene Pappas in the Three Hierarchs Greek Orthodox Church of Brooklyn.  He nurtured Stefanos every week and also assisted in another small miracle.

Through all of Stefanos’ mental changes in February 2012, I noticed his movement disorders mysteriously disappearing.  His coordination was coming back.  He still could not add but was beginning to read and write again.  Although he was making progress, he still could not focus for more than ten seconds.

Currently, because of brain swelling, Stefanos cannot be alone since he is in his own world most times and speaks about things only I understand from his childhood or computer talk or TV/movies. He can and has easily run into traffic. He does not want to see his friends because of his affliction. As a child he knows he is different now and as a mother this only breaks my heart even further.  Stefanos is aware of what is going on and at times tells me, "Mommy, I am petrified." I know he is, but currently I cannot stop this progression.

Our days are like rollercoasters. But to look at the bright side, Melina, my daughter, is slowly moving back into the house. My parents, who raised Stefanos while I was working, are learning to deal. Because of recent positive interventions from our church, family and friends, Stefanos is now pleasant, smiling and laughing. My husband got the appropriate help and is learning how to deal with Stefanos’ situation and is contributing to Stefanos' treatment.  Although Stefanos’ symptoms are slightly better compared to February, he still has an autoimmune disease that destroys cognitive skills, and motor skills. What else can a kid endure and keep smiling? He is quite amazing.

There are a few important reasons why I am sharing my story and asking for needed donations. After a twenty-five year career as a video editor, I am not working. We have been financially devastated because of Stefanos’s illness. Medical bills are drastically piling up.  We can not make ends meet.  Monies collected from this site will go towards monthly bills and Stefanos and his care. In order for Stefanos and many kids like him to get better, further monies for research will be needed and monies will go towards Dr. Chugani's  PET scan research, Dr. T's genetic research and Dr. Cunningham's PANDA blood tests.  I am disappointed to find that no major corporation as of yet will fund any medical research that a simple antibiotic or antiviral can cure, if caught in time.  And lastly, I ask for financial support for materials for presentations at schools, hospitals, doctor's offices and religious institutions, to educate the community through the Story of Stefanos.  The pdfs in the Gallery section have great info on how to recognize PANDAS/PANS  in the early stages and come from another wonderful website, www.pandasnetwork.org  Some exciting news is that the A&E channel has interviewed me and Dr. T for their new series.  The Staten Island Advance newspaper has also been notified.  And due to a wonderful person at our church, we now have this indiegogo campaign. Please also keep your eye out on the web for the latest info discussed at the Irvine CA conference on PANDAS/PANS (Sept. 24, 25 2012) 

A Sisters Love:

My daughter, Melina is amazing at age twelve.  Unfortunately she has had to mature overnight.  Her art talent has blossomed in the past three months. Her work was even displayed at the New York Art Club in Gramercy Park. A wonderful woman, Laura Brunetti, from her organization called, "The Caring Canvas", helps families in need and was able to assist Melina. Recently, we made a Facebook page for Melina's art called, "Melina Loves Art for Stefanos." If you are interested you can see more of Melina’s work there.

We Need Your Help for Stefanos:

In closing, I need this story to go viral. There are 400 families with anti NMDA receptor encephalitis on Facebook. Their horror stories are quite the same or worse. There are over 1000 families with documented PANDAS/PANS cases on pandasnetwork.org 's database. We need to educate doctors to stop and think  PANDAS/PANS/autoimmune encephalitis before mental illness in children (and that means OCD as well). Misdiagnosed encephalitis causes life long complications. We need to learn more about both NMDA and PANDAS so kids are not placed on the wrong drugs. Believe it or not a prescription of appropriate antibiotics or antiviral at the time of a child’s onset may take PANDAS/PANS children off Zoloft or OCD meds, just maybe!!!? We need to stop our medical system and its politics and set up embraced protocols for these diseases.  When we break a finger, we get an X-ray before doctors treat the condition. When we have a mental status change, no matter what age it seems, many times doctors prescribe non-effective psych drugs. Think about this…Did we ever give our autistic kids PET scans? In my opinion, children demonstrating Autism/PANDAS/PANS/NMDA encephalitis symptoms must be given a PET scan before psych drugs are prescribed to them. Ironically enough, in our case psych hospitals refused to give antibiotics and the medical hospitals refused antibiotic treatment because doctors felt Stefanos was a psych patient. Medical or not it is so sad that there is a separation of these two types of hospitals in America today. Must I go on?

Stefanos and my family are finally asking for help after a four-year struggle.  PANDAS/PANS does exist and research must continue with our help. We gratefully appreciate your support. I know, with all your prayers and love, we can educate the world about PANDAS/PANS. Thank you.

story:
We are a group of International Rescue and Relief students from Union College who are traveling to Nicaragua for the Spring Semester of 2013. While there we will be conducting some informative classes on a few very important issues affecting the indigenous Nicaraguan people. One of these issues is the topic of Malaria. We are attempting to raise a small amount of money in order to purchase some much needed mosquito nets. These nets will be handed out at each of the classes. Because the Miskito people of Nicaragua rarely receive a quality education, there are many basic health ideas which they do not yet understand. We are hoping to raise awareness about Malaria so that we can not only help treat the symptoms of Malaria, but prevent it as well. We are extremely excited about this project and hope you will be as well!

Any way you choose to support this cause would be greatly appreciated! If you would prefer to donate mosquito nets directly to Union College feel free to email us and we will give you our contact information. Also, any publicity we receive will be very helpful. Share this page on Facebook or tell your friends about it!

story:
Our Organization

Operation ASHA is India’s largest NGO dedicated to eradicating tuberculosis (TB) worldwide and has been working in Cambodia since 2010.  

The United Nations recognizes Operation ASHA among the top public-private partnerships in the world. The organization works closely with the Ministry of Health (Cambodia) in five Operating Districts (ODs) in Phnom Penh and Takeo.  

In areas where we work (in Cambodia),

  • We more than doubled TB case detection rates in 2012
  • We found up to 100% of TB cases in our Operating Districts
  • Our treatment default rate by patients is at a low rate of 2%


TB in Cambodia

In Cambodia, TB is the second biggest cause of death and one of the most serious public health challenges. The country has one of the highest TB prevalence rate in the world (source:WHO). Each TB patient infects, on average 12 others before dying. Therefore, it is all the more critical that every patient is detected and fully treated as early as possible.


Our Model

(A) We provide Directly Observed Therapy Shortcourse (DOTS) and diagnostic services at patients’ door step - We engage mobile field supervisors who connect our patients to the health services they need.

(B) We support our patients through TB Treatment - Our emphasis on high quality and repeated counselling of patients and families improves adherence and treatment outcome. Field supervisors are also trained to take care of simple side effects due to TB treatment with over-the-counter drugs. Our field supervisors also involve the family early in the process, to facilitate strong family support throughout the treatment regime.

(C) We ensure DOTS is provided in accordance to National Tuberculosis Program guidelines - We engage independent auditors to do weekly random service audits and have strong processes to monitor outcomes and rectify lapses regularly.

(D) We guarantee data quality – We are able to measure, quantify and audit our data through the implementation of our biometrics system.


Our Patients' Voices

"I was sick for a long time until I met Operation ASHA's field supervisor. She took me to the hospital to confirm that I had TB and followed up with daily medication for my condition. Only after taking the medication, I became stronger. 

I can now work to earn money and support my family like I used to. Without Operation ASHA, I won't be well today. My wish is for all TB patients to take their medication faithfully. Thank you Operation ASHA for saving my life."   


"My name is Sothed and I am 14 years old. I live with my younger sister and grandmother. Everyday, I work in the rice fields so that I can earn money to buy food for the family. 

My grandmother is sick with TB.  I hope she will get better so that our family situation will improve. When I found out my grandmother had TB, I was scared it might spread to me.  Now, I'm not afraid anymore because we have help from Operation ASHA."


You can make a difference today

Passing it on

Share this campaign with everyone you know and be a fundraiser today!

  • Visit us at Operation ASHA's website
  • Like us on Facebook and Twitter
story_txt:
Our Organization
Operation ASHA is India’s largest NGO dedicated to eradicating tuberculosis (TB) worldwide and has been working in Cambodia since 2010.  
The United Nations recognizes Operation ASHA among the top public-private partnerships in the world. The organization works closely with the Ministry of Health (Cambodia) in five Operating Districts (ODs) in Phnom Penh and Takeo.  
In areas where we work (in Cambodia),



We more than doubled TB case detection rates in 2012
We found up to 100% of TB cases in our Operating Districts
Our treatment default rate by patients is at a low rate of 2%



TB in Cambodia
In Cambodia, TB is the second
biggest cause of death and one of the most serious
public health challenges. The country
has one of the highest TB prevalence rate in the world (source:WHO). Each
TB patient infects, on average 12 others before dying. Therefore, it is all the
more critical that every patient is detected and fully treated as early as possible.



Our Model






(A) We provide Directly Observed Therapy Shortcourse (DOTS) and diagnostic services at patients’ door step - We engage mobile field supervisors who connect our patients to the health services they need.
(B) We support our patients through TB Treatment - Our emphasis
on high quality and repeated counselling of patients and families improves adherence
and treatment outcome. Field supervisors
are also trained to take care of simple side effects due to TB treatment with
over-the-counter drugs. Our field supervisors
also involve the family early in the process, to facilitate strong family
support throughout the treatment regime.

(C) We ensure DOTS is provided in accordance to National Tuberculosis Program guidelines - We engage independent auditors to do weekly random service audits and have strong processes to monitor outcomes and rectify lapses regularly.
(D) We guarantee data quality – We are able to measure, quantify and audit our data through the implementation of our biometrics system.


Our Patients' Voices


"I was sick for a long time until I met Operation ASHA's field supervisor. She took me to the hospital to confirm that I had TB and followed up with daily medication for my condition. Only after taking the medication, I became stronger. 
I can now work to earn money and support my family like I used to. Without Operation ASHA, I won't be well today. My wish is for all TB patients to take their medication faithfully. Thank you Operation ASHA for saving my life."   



"My name is Sothed and I am 14 years old. I live with my younger sister and grandmother. Everyday, I work in the rice fields so that I can earn money to buy food for the family. 
My grandmother is sick with TB.  I hope she will get better so that our family situation will improve. When I found out my grandmother had TB, I was scared it might spread to me.  Now, I'm not afraid anymore because we have help from Operation ASHA."

You can make a difference today






Passing it on

Share this campaign with everyone you know and be a fundraiser today!

Visit us at Operation ASHA's website

Like us on Facebook and Twitter

story:
Dear Friends and Family,

Andy and I are very excited to share a beautiful new beginning, and we invite you to be a part of it! We are expecting a little one on March 10th, 2014! We have a wonderful midwife, and we are planning a home birth in Nashville, TN. Due to our high-deductible insurance plan and the nature of insurance coverage for midwifery care in this area, we will be paying for our prenatal, birth, and postpartum care out-of-pocket. We're asking for your loving support to help us manifest this dream! We are blessed to be experiencing this miracle of life in our family, and we are ecstatic to be sharing it with you!



How You Can Help

Our goal is to raise $4,000, which will go directly towards supporting our growing family through this journey. This money will cover all the costs of our prenatal care, birth, and postpartum care, including newborn exams. It will also cover childbirth classes, labs, and ultrasounds. Even if we do not reach our goal, any donations we receive will still be used to pay for as much of these expenses as possible! Your contributions will help us welcome our baby into this world the way we dream! They will also relieve us of some financial stress such a major life event presents for us at this time and allow us to focus more on what really matters - our family and our new baby! We are infinitely grateful for your support, and we're so excited to share our pregnancy and birth experience with you!


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that times are tough for many people right now and some just can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can’t help! We would love to have your support, prayers, and continued friendship. Here are more ways you can help us
  • Get the word out by posting our campaign on Facebook and emailing friends!
  • Check out our online registry if you'd like to purchase a gift for the baby. We will open these gifts at our baby shower. (Date soon to come!)
  • Keep us in your thoughts and prayers, that this child may be born safely, peacefully, and at home.


With Infinite Gratitude 

and Love for You All,

Kyndall, Andy, & Baby

(More Family Photos Soon to Come!)


~Blessed Be~

story:
Short Summary

I was recently diagnosed with Rheumatoid Arthritis and Schizophrenia and am attempting to seek and help possible. I have been suspended from work on Emergency Detention while I attend a Out-Patient Program to find a balance of medication and support.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm needing at least $1,000 to clear what has added up thus far, but any help would be greatly appreciated. I'm not sure what I could offer in return other than updates on the condition and perhaps attempting to raise awareness on the mental illness.

    The Impact

    You will be helping me get the medical attention I require to become stable and return to society as a hard working citizen that I once was.

      Risks & Challenges

      There's no real risk associated. It's purely a donation based kind of thing.

        Other Ways You Can Help

        I would appreciate any outlets or information that can help assist me in the cost of medications and doctors visits.

story:
#growlove

Additional Funds Will Support Larger Trees, Lusher Garden

We are excited to reach our $35,000 goal! With just two days left in our campaign, we would like to raise an additional $3,150 so that we can purchase larger trees to plant in the healing garden. Incorporating the wheelchair ramp and replacing our retaining walls means that we will have to cut down some of the existing trees. We will replace the trees in the new garden and would love to be able to purchase larger trees -- river birches, Japanese maples, star magnolias -- to create a more lush and inviting garden right from the start. More funding will support taller and fuller new trees!

Help Us Build an Accessible Healing Garden for Homeless Men and Women with HIV & Cancer

For 25 years at Joseph's House, we have welcomed and cared for homeless men and women with AIDS and cancer in Washington, DC. So much about our warm, inviting home and community creates an environment that nurtures the spiritual and emotional healing of those who have suffered for much of their lives.

Now we are working to extend that healing spirit into our garden. Right now our garden misses the mark: it's inaccessible, hard to navigate, has lingering rain puddles, and lacks areas for solitude, conversation, and small gatherings. With your support we can transform the garden into a fully accessible refuge that awakens the senses and creates an environment for introspection, prayer, and quiet conversation for those facing some of life's deepest challenges and questions.


Our Dreams for the Healing Garden 

Accessible: Based on universal design principles, our healing garden will welcome everyone in our community. Its fully accessible entrance, pathways and materials will convey hospitality to those who use wheelchairs or walkers.

Inviting: Our healing garden will be a bright and glorious sign of welcome for all who enter, inviting resting in, lingering; conversation. It will be a calm and beautiful place for solitude or for visiting with family and friends.

Contemplative: The plantings and other natural features will awaken the senses of sight, smell and touch, creating an environment for introspection and prayer for those facing some of life’s biggest questions and challenges.

Neighborly: A low perimeter wall with a bench along the sidewalk, small lending library, and a built-in fresh water bowl for neighborhood dogs will invite neighbors and passers-by to pause for a moment to talk or to rest.

Gathering: Our healing garden will be a place to come together for music and memorials and other celebrations to heal and renew the spirit.

Remembering: The garden will have dedicated areas to honor the hundreds of men and women who have lived, loved, and died among us. In our healing garden, we will also give thanks for those who live with us today and humbly anticipate the men and women who will join us in the years to come.

Learning About Love for 25 Years 

Opened in 1990 in response to the lack of safe, stable housing for poor men with AIDS in Washington, DC, Joseph’s House today offers a welcoming community and comprehensive nursing and support services to homeless men and women with late-stage and end-stage AIDS and terminal cancer. 

Our clinical staff and trained caregivers work to create a home where the values of unreserved love and friendship are practiced. With tenderness and exquisite care we accompany men and women who, without Joseph’s House, would likely die a lonely, isolated death. Together, we nurture the living and accompany the dying, providing a depth of physical, emotional and spiritual support that creates the possibility for profound healing and the restoration of individual dignity.

Help us Build the Terrace of Remembrance 

The garden's cornerstone will be the Terrace of Remembrance. Located where we have long held an annual memorial service for residents, the beautifully designed Terrace of Remembrance will recall the spirits of the hundreds of men and women who have lived, loved and died among us these past twenty five years and also be a special place for a few, or for many, to gather for conversation, music, memorial services, and other events to heal and renew the spirit.

The terrace will feature natural stone paving, a specially designed remembrance wall, and a rough stone altar –  elements that will make the Terrace of Remembrance a place of meaning and comfort. 

We need your financial gift to begin preparing the site, to bring in new, rich soil and for the trees and plants that will thrive in that soil! Your financial gift will provide beautiful hand-made benches that will invite folks to come into this space and stay a while. Your support will also help to fill the space with the names of those we remember and those who support our mission of justice and compassion. 

A Dream Coming to Life

Our long-held dream for a healing garden took a huge step forward in spring 2014 when we won MakeDC's citywide design competition Designing Dreams. Working with MakeDC, we have refined our vision for the garden. Creating a fully accessible garden is a bigger challenge than we anticipated. It requires replacing a large retaining wall so we can integrate a wheelchair-friendly ramp, which will become the garden's primary entrance. Completing the garden will require generous support from individuals, as well as from corporate and foundation donors that support our mission of compassion and justice.  

Other Ways to Help Us #growlove

We know not everyone can contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help us #growlove! 

  • Please help us spread the word far and wide about this campaign
  • You can use the social media sharing tools here on our Indiegogo page.

Other Ways to Help Us #growlove We know not everyone can contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help us #growlove! 
 Please help us spread the word far and wide about this campaign
You can use the social media sharing tools here on our Indiegogo page.

story:
Why Mental Health?....Because UMATTER

There is not one person who has not been impacted by mental health challenges, directly or indirectly. It does not matter if you are rich or poor; black, white, red, yellow, or brown, mental health affects us all. Just read the headlines...from over 900 deaths from mass shootings in the last 7 years to an  alarming number of suicides by celebrities and popular religious leaders including Robin Williams, Don Cornelius, Lee Thompson Young, and Pastor Teddy Parker. These are only a few names that have made national news. Think about the countless number of people who we know and love that suffer from mental health challenges but never make the headlines.

You or a loved one may have experienced overwhelming stress, anxiety, depression, or a more serious mental health issue. I am Dr. Sherry and like many of you, I grew up in a community where mental health was and still is a topic that you do not dare talk about openly. People tend to ignore mental health problems because they are often embarrassed or ashamed to deal with them.

UMATTER Campaign

Stigma is the number one reason why many people, especially African Americans, do not talk about mental health challenges or seek help. It is time to change that! Stigma is something that can be changed because it all starts in the mind. The Edge Empowerment Foundation and myself are excited to launch UMATTER, a national campaign to reduce mental health stigma and increase awareness while promoting mental health wellness. UMATTER (Understanding Mental Health Awareness Through Technology, Education, and Research) is an innovative program where you can interact and hear celebrities share their stories about mental health challenges as well as enjoy music and other forms of entertainment. Multiple events are planned that will be exciting, interactive, informative, and empowering.

The Need

The need for UMATTER is great! Stigma is embedded and perpetuated through family and friends, churches and other faith based communities, cultural stereotypes, and media reports. We are our brother's keeper and it is our goal to reduce the stigma of mental health by creating platforms for everyday people. Combating mental health stigma is our number one priority. We need your help in donations, sponsorships, and in-kind services. Join us and make a difference in someone's life.


Testimonial........

I was diagnosed with Kidney Cancer in 2013, and I went through the process as if it was a piece of cake. Never realizing that my entire life was altered with one diagnosis. I went through a Radical Nephrectomy losing my left kidney. Openly, I wore a mask pretending that life was amazing and secretly, I was a wreck, lost for words and I didn't know how to feel and I did not have anyone to express my feelings to. I was spiraling downward and I was literally depressed. I started seeing Dr. Sherry and I found a safe haven, I was able to say the things to her that I could not say to anyone else. I found myself getting stronger; I could say the word cancer without wanting to jump off a cliff. She took me through the process of healing step by step, she never judged me, and she willed me back. It is because of her, I am back and now preparing to speak to those worldwide about life after kidney cancer. All I can say is she is the best thing that has ever happened to me………

Signed

Victor Living through Cancer!!!!

UMATTER Movement

UMATTER will impact the lives of individuals, families, and communities tremendously. We need your help in making mental health and mental wellness common household words. We must remove the stigma in order for this to happen we must have a comprehensive program that promotes emotional wellness. We are dedicated to seeing this mission through. Our program format consist of;

Training Modules for Faith-based and Non Faith-based organizations

Caregiver Support Network

Mental Health Registry

UMATTER Empowerment Tour" Conversations with Dr. Sherry and Friends"      Conversations with Dr.Sherry and Friends Roundtable Discussions

Touring Roundtable Discussions "Erasing Stigma Worldwide"

Theatrical Presentations

UMATTER Youth Real Talk Tour

Our Mission is to educate locally and impact globally.  Please join us in making a difference!

We Need & What You Get

Dr. Sherry and the Edge Empowerment Foundation's goal is to raise $50,000 to officially launch the UMATTER campaign and events. UMATTER is not just a campaign, it's a movement! We need your help now! Please join the movement and help us by giving donations, sponsorships, and in-kind services. By giving to this cause, you will be helping change lives.

When you donate….

$10- #UMATTER Shout Out!! you will receive a personal shout out on our #UMATTER Facebook page

$25 or more you will also receive an :#UMATTER Souvenir Mug".

$50 or more you will receive an "I am Change Tee Shirt"

$100 or more you will also receive an autographed copy of Dr. Sherry’s book "The Single-Married Woman".

$500 or more you will receive one day event pass to a UMATTER event.

$1000 or more you will also receive a 2- day event pass to event.

$5000 or more you will also receive a corporate table and a 2-day VIP pass to an UMATTER event. In addition, you will receive 2-gift packages, donor recognition, and special print and media recognition.

$10,000 or more you will also receive 3 VIP event tickets to an UMATTER event with VIP access, 3-gift packages, donor recognition, and special print/media recognition. 

*UMATTER is a part of the Edge Empowerment Foundation, a nonprofit organization. All donations will be used to help achieve our mission.

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks or challenges associated with the UMATTER campaign. Our mission of reducing mental health stigma and increasing mental health awareness while promoting mental health wellness will be achieved with you help.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone may not be able to contribute financially. However, everyone can still be a part of the UMATTER Campaign. Volunteering your time or even spreading the word on social media is needed and greatly appreciated! Please visit us at www.edgeempowerment.com to find more ways that you can get involved and make a difference.

mental health wellness will be achieved with you help.
Other
Ways You Can Help
We understand that not everyone may not be able to contribute
financially. However, everyone can still be a part of the UMATTER Campaign.
Volunteering your time or even spreading the word on social media is needed and
greatly appreciated! Please visit us at www.edgeempowerment.com
to find more ways that you can get involved and make a difference.

story:
Healthcare-associated infections (HAIs) are a growing threat in the United States and worldwide. Approximately 1.7 million HAIs occur in U.S. hospitals each year, resulting in 99,000 deaths and an estimated $20 billion in healthcare costs.  While public health initiatives have focused upon hand washing as a means of decreasing the spread of infection, few efforts have been directed toward the equipment most healthcare providers use on a daily basis - their stethoscopes.

Recent studies have shown that a physician’s stethoscope harbors more bacteria than nearly all regions of the physician’s hands.  The implication is clear – stethoscope hygiene may be as important as hand hygiene in preventing HAIs. Unfortunately, healthcare workers only manage to wash their hands about 30% of the time, and they are even less likely to clean their stethoscopes between uses.  

Enter Stethoskin™.

Stethoskin™ stethoscope covers represent a breakthrough in the area of stethoscope hygiene. The patent-pending design uses Sharklet™ technology to limit the adherence, survival, and transfer of pathogenic bacteria on the stethoscope diaphragm. Even when you forget to cleanse your stethoscope between patient encounters, Stethoskin™ will continue to work - 24 hours/day, 7 days/week – to limit contamination of your device.

Stethoskin™ (patent-pending) is the only stethoscope cover made using Sharklet™ technology, leveraging the science of biomimicry– the imitation of patterns in nature to solve complex human problems. The antimicrobial effect of Sharklet™ based products comes from its unique micro surface pattern. By emulating the pattern of a shark’s dermal denticles, Sharklet™ provides a natural, non-toxic means of inhibiting bacterial growth - without the use of antibiotics or other chemicals. Sharklet™ based films are used in the manufacture of Stethoskin™stethoscope covers to provide continuous, non-toxic protection from bacterial growth and transfer without the risk of antimicrobial resistance.

This patented micro-surface pattern has been rigorously tested, and has been shown to limit the adherence and survival of pathogenic bacteria. In laboratory studies, Sharklet™ patterned surfaces have proven effective against:

 • Staphylococcus epidermidis 

 • Staphylococcus aureus 

 • Pseudomonas aeruginosa 

 • Escherichia coli 

 • VRE 

 • MRSA 

Compared to other stethoscope covers, Stethoskin™ offers several advantages including:

Non-disposable - Stethoskin™ remains on the surface of the stethoscope diaphragm for up to 90 days, continuously protecting your stethoscope from contamination. 

Non-toxic - Stethoskin™ does not contain chemicals or antibiotics; it leverages Sharklet™ surface pattern technology to inhibit bacterial growth naturally. 

No risk of resistant strains - Because it does not use antibiotics, Stethoskin™ does not contribute to the development of resistant bacterial strains or “superbugs”. 

High Compliance - Stethoskin™ works around the clock, serving as a safety net when cleaning protocols fail. 

Reduce costs - Hospital-acquired infections account for billions of dollars in excess healthcare costs each year, with an estimated cost between $16,000 and $20,000 per patient.

Economical - Because of its novel approach to infection control, a single Stethoskin™ can reduce contamination for just pennies a day.

Infection control is a serious problem in modern healthcare.  Become a part of the solution by supporting Stethoskin™.

story:
Do you have experience of Dementia?

Then you know that simple solutions can achieve great things

Almost everyone we talk to, knows someone affected by dementia – here's a really easy way of engaging, improving, helping and hopefully making everybody’s life that little bit better. Letting mum be herself for longer!
We're passionate about inventing products which help others. Our latest is simple, effective, and already has widespread interest from many professionals, carers and family and friends of people with Dementia.
It's a special placemat; not exciting we know, but hugely beneficial.

"Setting the table is one of those tasks which is a low risk activity and yet engages with the mothering instinct, so strong in many women with Dementia. Engagement in ‘mothering’ or ‘help around the home’ type of tasks are beneficial, and this place-mat enables another simple and worthwhile activity"


As part of the care process to sustain active engagement of women with Dementia or Alzheimer’s, its often very positive to assist with household activities, for example cooking. As the effects of dementia increase then the kitchen becomes an unfit environment to engage in and alternative ‘normal household tasks’ are needed in order to maintain self-worth and fulfilment. One of these tasks being to set the table; the problem being that its easy to forget how to.

The purpose of this project is to encourage continuing engagement, particularly of a large proportion of women, by enabling them to set the table whilst providing clues to aid the failing memory. This is achieved by producing a non-slip place mat which has high contrast pictograms of where the plates, cups, and cutlery go, providing both a guide as to how to lay the table properly and to maintain an active and worthwhile activity for the person with dementia.

Its made from various specialist materials which make it unique, so its:

  • Food safe – you eat off it
  • Strong ….. robust ….. flexible ….. non-slip
  • Washable, either by hand or machine
  • Can take extremely high temperatures (>300 degrees C)
  • Available in Blue, Green, Red
  • High contrast for failing eyesight
Simple, but highly effective!

Our goals and hopefully yours

The only barrier we face is raising enough cash for the initial order, as we have to invest in a minimum of 5000 units to achieve our cost breakpoint from the manufacturers.

We've already secured sales in excess of 1500 units from our existing distributor networks and we have companies in Europe, USA and Australia all interested in becoming resellers once they can have samples and the surety of supply. We've raised significant cash from our own resources but need a further £500 - £1000, to complete the funding syndicate.

BUT ...

... our goals through crowdfunding is not just the cash alone; we want people to get this product into care and residential homes and get them used. The more people are aware these exist, the better life becomes for those who use them - every little bit helps.

The simplest way, of course is to buy one or a set for 'mum or dad', someone you know, or perhaps you have a local home, hospice, memory cafe or community centre, you might like to support. If anyone wants to support the idea by donation, we guarantee we will donate the equivalent number of 'Platzmats' to suitable homes or charities.

  • Every part of this fund will go towards providing 'Platzmats' for people with dementia - there are no overheads included in these costings - its all about getting the product out there.
We are thoroughly committed to this project so if we don't raise the cash then the project will take much longer, and we'll miss the Christmas window of opportunity.

What it means

Feedback from around the world is extremely positive seeing it as a  very simple lo-tech solution offering real benefits for keeping people’s minds active.

It takes no training or understanding; it gives all the information required; it gets people involved, it give people self-worth, and at the end of their day, they can congratulate themselves and feel fulfilled to some extent, that they’ve been part of a community; allowing them to continue their lives with this difficult condition with a level of dignity, engagement and happiness.

We can do it!

We're a small engineering design company who have developed several products for dementia. We have a good track record of identifying needs, designing the product to suit those needs, and then getting it to manufacture.

The technology has been surprisingly challenging from material selection and advanced printing technologies, but designing and developing product is what we do; and we've done all the hard work in getting this right.
We’re now ready to launch.
If you are involved with dementia then you may know some of our other products already out there. Checkout our
  • Simple Music Player for Dementia
  • 'Blys' nightlight for the elderly
  • FAB 'Frenchay Alphabet Boards'
  • or our main company website at www.E2L.uk.com

Risks & Challenges

After 8 months development of materials, processing and testing, the technical challenges have been resolved. We need to commission the final production and get it to our distribution network (and finding new ones).

To maximise our marketing push, during November we're attending MEDICA, Europes largest medical exhibition in Germany, and we'll be at the OT show in the NEC, in Birmingham, UK.

We want the product to be available in early December, which we can achieve if we get the funds.

Technical stuff:

  • Size: 378mm x 304mm x 1.1mm (14.9” x 12.0” x 0.04”)
  • Material: Reinforced Silicone Rubber with single colour printing
  • Washable: Wipe clean or can withstand high temperature dishwashing
  • Durable, long lasting and heat resistant
  • Slip resistant on both surfaces providing a grip on table and crockery
  • Non-toxic, Latex free and chemically inert, FDA approved for contact with food
  • Product supplied in individual polythene bags

Can you help us?

Please, please, please - all sharing and networking is important in achieving this project. Any mention in specific Dementia and Alzheimers groups, memory cafes, Homes, Hospices, Day Centres, Community groups would be most appreciated to get this simple but effective tool up and running. If you can, please spread the word using:

  • Indegogo campaign tools
  • Like and Share us on our Facebook Product Page
  • Tweet away, our page is at E2L Products
  • Pin it
  • and anything else you can think of which spreads this simple idea and gets people involved
