story:
Pour la page en Français, c'est par ici !


Oliba is a cute owl that you can tie to your child's cuddly toy that communicates with an App.

  • Never loose the cuddly toy again: Oliba is a smart babyproof cuddly toy tracker.
  • Share riveting stories that foster creativity: Oliba is a storyteller with endless imagination
  • Soothe your child to sleep: Oliba is a connected musical nightlight

 

 

     

     

     

     

     

    •  
    •  

    •  

     

     

     

     


     

     

     

     

     

    Click Here for English FAQ!


    Français
     

     

    Oliba est une petite chouette qui s'attache à tous les doudous et communique avec son App.

    • Fini le doudou perdu : Oliba est un retrouve doudou malin adapté aux enfants
    • Partagez des histoires passionnantes : Oliba est un raconteur d'histoires plein d'imagination
    • Aidez votre enfant à mieux dormir : Oliba est une veilleuse musicale sur mesure

     

     



     


     



     


     


     


     

     


    Pour remonter en haut de page et acheter c'est ici !   

     

     


    ---- FAQ FRANÇAIS----
     

    SPECIFICATIONS PRODUIT

     

    Qu’est-ce qu’Oliba ?

    Oliba est le chouette complice des enfants et du doudou. Oliba s’attache à tous les doudous avec une attache universelle. Grâce à son application smartphone, Oliba est personnalisable pour s’adapter au développement des enfants de 0 à 5 ans.

    Oliba est un retrouve doudou malin et une veilleuse musicale connectée, qui raconte des histoires pleine d’imagination pour développer la créativité de votre enfant.

     

    A quoi peut me servir Oliba?

    Parce qu’un dodo sans doudou c’est impossible, et parce que le doudou ne suffit pas toujours à s’endormir sereinement, Smarty Crew a développé Oliba.

    Avec Oliba, vous ne perdrez plus le doudou, elle vous fait gagner du temps et de l’énergie.

    Oliba vous permet de passer plus de temps avec votre enfant en partageant des histoires passionnantes : Elle connait de supers histoires de Radio Pomme d’Api pour tous les enfants de 0 à 5 ans. 

    Avec Oliba, aidez votre enfant à mieux dormir.

     

    Comment marche Oliba ?

    Oliba s'attache à tous les doudous et communique avec son App en toute sécurité.

    Faites ululer Oliba avec l'App pour retrouver le doudou à la maison sans stress ni larmes. L'App vous alerte si le doudou est à plus de 30 mètres, et vous montre la dernière position connue du doudou.

    Les enfants adorent les histoires. Elles les aident à grandir en développant leur imaginaire. Avec l’App, choisissez une histoire de la bibliothèque d'Oliba ou enregistrez votre voix, Oliba la racontera. Oliba connait de supers histoires de Radio Pomme d'Api pour tous les enfants de 0 à 5 ans. En deux clics, Oliba enregistre l'histoire de votre choix. Vous pouvez la démarrer avec l'App ou manuellement en appuyant quelques secondes sur le bec d'Oliba. Les enfants peuvent s'évader dans leur imaginaire et écouter votre voix partout et à tout moment, sans aucun téléphone ni aucune connexion.

    Avec l'App, paramétrez une veilleuse et choisissez une berceuse dans la bibliothèque d'Oliba. Vous pouvez aussi enregistrer votre voix pour endormir votre enfant. Quand c'est l'heure de dormir, Oliba scintille dans le noir et chante la berceuse pour calmer et endormir votre enfant selon ses peurs et ses besoins. Démarrez-la avec l'App ou en appuyant brièvement sur le bec d'Oliba. N'importe qui peut démarrer manuellement la séquence, à la crèche ou à la maison, sans avoir besoin de l'App.

     

    A partir de quel âge mon enfant peut utiliser Oliba ? Comment Oliba s’adapte à l’enfant ?

    Oliba est la chouette complice des enfants de 0 à 5 ans car Oliba connait de supers histoires de Radio Pomme d'Api adaptées à l’âge de votre enfant. Vous pouvez aussi enregistrer votre propre voix.

     

     

    Quel est le contenu disponible ? Comment avoir du nouveau contenu?

    Oliba est livrée avec 10 berceuses et 10 histoires (5 en langue française et 5 en langue anglaise). Elles sont fournies et sélectionnées par Radio Pomme d’Api. Du nouveau contenu sera proposé directement depuis l’application une fois commercialisée. 

    Où et quand puis-je télécharger l’application ?

    Quand vous recevrez votre Oliba, rendez-vous sur l’Apple Store et sur Google Play pour télécharger gratuitement l’application Oliba.

    Quelles fonctionnalités existent sur l’application Oliba ?

    Grâce à l’application, vous pouvez faire ululer Oliba et localiser le doudou. Vous pouvez personnaliser les lumières, les histoires et les berceuses en fonction des goûts de votre enfant. Vous pouvez aussi enregistrer vos propres histoires.

    Est-ce qu’Oliba peut se décrocher de la peluche ?

    L’attache universelle d’Oliba a été conçue pour qu’une fois attachée, Oliba ne puisse pas être retirée par un enfant.

    En quelle couleur sera disponible Oliba ?

    Un sondage sera réalisé après la clôture de la campagne de crowdfunding pour que vous puissiez voter pour votre couleur préférée. Oliba sera livrée dans le jeu de couleur ayant reçu le plus de votes.

     

    En quelle langue est disponible Oliba ?

    Oliba est livrée avec des berceuses et histoires en langue française et anglaise. L’application sera disponible en français et anglais.

    Quelles données collecte Oliba ? Quelle est votre politique de confidentialité ?

    Nous ne collectons aucune donnée personnelle. Nous avons fait le choix de respecter les enfants, et ainsi votre vie de famille.

    Oliba analyse uniquement les informations concernant les chansons et histoires (types et durées) afin de vous offrir dans le futur du contenu adapté.

    Vous pouvez consulter notre politique de confidentialité en cliquant sur ce lien.

    SECURITE ET CERTIFICATION

     

    Qu’en est-il des ondes ?

    Oliba et son App communiquent en Bluetooth 4.0. C'est le protocole de communication le plus léger qui existe aujourd'hui.

    Oliba est passive, c'est avant tout un récepteur. Elle n'envoie aucune donnée au téléphone et n’émet qu’un signal de présence, bien plus faible qu’un SMS.

    La connexion avec le smartphone peut être coupée à l'aide d'un bouton. Comme Oliba enregistre dans sa mémoire réglages et contenus, les fonctions histoire, veilleuse et berceuse fonctionnent même quand la connexion est coupée!

    De quoi est fabriqué Oliba? Oliba contient-il des phtalates, du Bisphénol A ou d’autres composants toxiques ?

    Oliba est composée de plastiques doux au toucher et de textiles utilisés pour les doudous : coton, ratine de velours, microfibre… Les matières d’Oliba sont conformes aux dispositions européennes sur le Bisphénol A et les phtalates pour les articles de puériculture destinés aux enfants de moins de 3 ans, et Oliba sera livrée en étant conformes aux certifications CE et FCC. Conformément à la Directive européenne ROHS, aucune substance dangereuse n’est présente dans les produits destinés aux enfants mais aussi dans les packagings.

    Le produit convient-il aux peaux sensibles ?

    Bien sûr, Oliba est doux pour la peau délicate de bébé. Tous les matériaux ont été testés et répondent aux normes européennes et américaines, notamment les certifications CE et FCC.

    Avez-vous déjà testé le produit ? Avec des bébés ?

    Oliba a été entièrement conçue avec plus de 150 familles, pendant plus d’un an et demi. Nous avons réussi à réaliser 4 prototypes qui ont tous été testés sur des enfants entre 0 et 5 ans. Grâce à ces ateliers de travail, nous avons crée un produit vraiment utile, qui est à la fois mignon et sur pour les enfants.

    Y-a-t’il un risque d‘étranglement?

    Non, il n’y a pas de risque d’étranglement car l’ensemble des composants et de leurs dimensions respectent les standards européens et américains, notamment en accord avec les certifications CE et FCC.

    La batterie est-elle dangereuse ?

    Non, pas plus qu’une autre batterie Lithium. Elle n’est pas amovible, est entièrement encapsulée dans une coque métallique et est complètement étanche pour qu'il n'y ait pas de fuites ou de petites pièces dangereuses.

    Y a-t-il un risque électrique ?

    Oliba répond à la Directive sur la Basse Tension. Cette Directive s'assure notamment de la sécurité électrique et est obligatoire pour les luminaires pour enfants.

    Est-ce qu’Oliba est homologué par la FDA,  l’Agence Américaine des produits alimentaires et médicamenteux?

    Les caractéristiques d’Oliba n’exigent pas d’homologation par la FDA.

    Est-ce qu’Oliba est résistant à l’eau ?

    Oliba n’est pas imperméable mais vous pouvez passer sa housse à la machine à laver.

    SPECIFICATIONS TECHNIQUES

    Avec quelle technologie fonctionne Oliba ?

    Oliba fonctionne avec le standard Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE), une technologie sécurisée.

    Est-ce que l’application fonctionne avec tous les smartphones?

    Aujourd’hui, l’application fonctionne sur les produits iOS : iPhone 6 Plus, iPhone 6, iPhone 5S, iPhone 5C, iPhone 5, iPhone 4S, iPad 3, iPad 4, iPad Air 2,iPad Air, iPad Mini 3, iPad Mini 2, iPad Mini et iPod Touch 5G.

    La compatibilité avec certains terminaux Android sera assurée d’ici la date de réception d’Oliba.

    Faut-il internet pour utiliser Oliba ?

    Oliba n’a pas besoin d’internet pour fonctionner. Vous avez uniquement besoin d’une connexion wifi quand vous voulez télécharger de nouveaux contenus pour Oliba.

    Que faire si je n’ai pas de smartphone ?

    Oliba fonctionnera mais partiellement. Vous pourrez utiliser le contenu présent dans Oliba mais ne pourrez pas personnaliser Oliba ni la localiser avec le doudou.

    Y a-t-il une application web?

    Non, Oliba ne fonctionne qu’avec une application smartphone.

    Puis-je utiliser l’application avec plusieurs Oliba ?

    Oui, nous avons conçu l’application pour qu’elle soit compatible avec plusieurs Oliba.

     

     

    Est-ce qu’Oliba peut se synchroniser à plusieurs Smartphones?

    Oui, nous avons autorisé la connexion d’Oliba à plusieurs Smartphones. Cela  permet à toute la famille mais aussi au personnel de la crèche ou à la baby-sitter de retrouver le doudou ou d’ajouter du nouveau contenu à Oliba.

    Est-ce que je peux changer la batterie?

    Non, la batterie est encapsulée à l’intérieur d’Oliba pour la sécurité des enfants. Elle ne peut donc pas être remplacée.

    Où est fabriquée Oliba ?

    Oliba est fabriquée en Chine. Nos partenaires fabricants sont certifiés ISO et respectent le plus haut niveau des standards de production et de contrôle qualité. Ils fabriquent déjà des produits pour enfants pour plusieurs grandes marques.

    DISTRIBUTION

    Où est disponible Oliba ?

    Oliba sera tout d’abord vendue directement depuis notre site internet. De plus, nous cherchons de forts partenariats de distribution. Nos priorités géographiques pour 2016 sont l’Europe et les Etats-Unis.

    Quand Oliba sera disponible ?

    Nous prévoyons de livrer Oliba en Juin 2016. Nous vous tiendrons au courant le plus tôt possible de ​​la date de livraison prévue de votre commande.

     

     

     

    SUPPORT CLIENT

     

    Oliba est-elle garantie ? 

    Oliba est garantie 1 an, les produits défectueux pourront être renvoyés à notre service client.

     

     

     

    CAMPAGNE DE CROWDFUNDING

     

    Pourquoi  le prix s’affiche-t-il en dollars ?

    Les prix seront fixés en dollars car c’est une campagne internationale.

     

    Y’a t’il des frais liés à la facturation en Dollars ?

    Des frais peuvent s’appliquer à un achat en devise étrangère. Ces frais dépendent de votre banque. 

     

    Où et pendant combien de temps pourrais-je précommander Oliba ?

    Les précommandes vont se faire sur le site de crowdfunding www.indiegogo.com pour une durée de 35 jours. Les prix seront fixés en dollars car c’est une campagne internationale.

     

    Quand recevrai-je Oliba chez moi ?

    Si la campagne n’atteint pas son objectif vous serez remboursés. Si la campagne atteint son objectif (environ 700 Oliba précommandés) le projet sera validé par Indiegogo. Les fonds récoltés seront utilisés pour la production et la certification des Oliba précommandés. Vous recevez votre Oliba 6 mois environ après la fin de la campagne.

     

    ---- ENGLISH FAQ ----

     

    PRODUCT FEATURES

    What is Oliba?

    Oliba is the smart buddy of children and cuddly toy. Oliba is easy to fasten to any cuddly toy. Its app makes it fully customizable so Oliba grows up with children from 0 to 5 years old. It is a smart cuddly toy tracker. Oliba is a connected musical nightlight; it teams up with the cuddly toy to soothe children to sleep. During the day, it fosters their active creativity by sharing riveting stories.

    Why should I use Oliba?

    Oliba helps you never lose the cuddly toy again. It helps you save time and energy everyday. With Oliba, you can spend more time with your child and share riveting stories that foster creativity. It knows great stories adapted to each stage of development for children from 0 to 5 years old. Oliba soothes your kid to sleep with the babysitter, in the kindergarten, in the car…

    How does Oliba work?

    Tie Oliba to your child cuddly toy and use the app to communicate with Oliba.Use Oliba app to make Oliba hoot and locate the cuddly toy at home whenever you need it. On the go, the app alerts you when the cuddly toy is over 100 feet away and gives you the latest known location of the cuddly toy.Pick one of Oliba's stories in our App or record your own story, Oliba will tell it. Oliba knows great stories adapted to each stage of development for children from 0 to 5 years old. In two clicks, the story you picked is stored in Oliba. It can be started with a long press on Oliba's face or with the App. Children can escape in their imaginary worlds and hear your soothing voice anytime in the day, without needing a phone! With the App, you can set a nightlight and pick a lullaby in Oliba's Library or record one with your voice. At bedtime, Oliba glows in the dark and sings the lullaby just the way you have set it to best fit your child's needs. Your bedtime routine is stored in Oliba. It can be started with the app or with a short press on Oliba's face. So yes, it works without a phone with the baby sitter, at the kindergarten or in the car.

    From what age can my child use Oliba? How does Oliba adapt to my child?

    Oliba is the smart buddy of children between 0 to 5 years, it knows great stories adapted to each stage of development of your child. You can also record your own stories.

    What content is available in Oliba? How to get other new content?

    Oliba is delivered with 10 lullabies and 10 stories (5 in English and 5 in French). There are selected and provided by a famous French press and publishing company  « Radio Pomme d’Api ». New content will be available directly from the App.

    What is the autonomy of Oliba? How to charge it?

    Oliba can be used more than 5 days without being recharged (average use case). Then you can recharge Oliba with a micro USB charger, which is supplied with Oliba.

    Where and when can I download the Oliba app?

    When you’ll receive your Oliba, visit the Apple Store and Google Play to download the Oliba application for free.

    What features are available in the Oliba app?

    Thanks to the application, you will be able to make Oliba hoot to locate the cuddly toy. You can customize the lights, stories and lullabies according to your child’s tastes. You can also record your own stories.

    Is Oliba compatible with all cuddly toys?

    Oliba has a universal fastener to be tied to any cuddly toy.

    Can Oliba unhook from the cuddly toy?

    Oliba should not come loose because its fastener has been manufactured to resist the children strength.

    In what colors is Oliba available?

    A survey will be conducted after the crowdfunding campaign for you to vote for your favorite colors. Oliba will be delivered with the color play that received the most votes.

    In what language is Oliba available ?

    Oliba is delivered with English and French lullabies and stories. The App will be available in English and French.

    What kind of information does Oliba gather? What’s our privacy policy? 

    We don’t collect any personal data. It is our choice to respect children and family personal lives. Oliba only analyses information about the songs and stories that you play (types and durations) to offer you adapted content in the future.

    SAFETY AND CERTIFICATION

    What about signal or radio technology used in Oliba?

    Oliba and its app communicate by Bluetooth 4.0. It is the lightest communication protocol invented today. Oliba is passive, it is a receiver. Meaning that it does not send any data to the phone and emits only a signal of presence, much lower than a SMS. The connection to the smartphone can be turned off with a button on Oliba. As Oliba storessettings and content, the functionalities of lullaby, storytelling and nightlight and can be used even when the connection is deactivated!

    What is Oliba made of?

    Oliba is made with a soft-touch plastic and cuddly toy-textiles (cotton, terry velour, microfiber plush…). Oliba will be delivered after CE and FCC certifications. Particularly Oliba’s materials comply with European rules on Biphenyl A and phthalates in childcare articles intended for children less than 3 years. In accordance with European ROHS Directive, hazardous substances are not present in products intended for children but either in packaging.

    Is it safe for delicate skin?

    Absolutely, Oliba is fully gentle on baby’s delicate skin. All the materials have been tested to and pass the European and American standards, namely CE and FCC certifications.

    What about product testing? Have you tested Oliba with babies?

    Oliba has been fully co-developed with over 150 families during more than a year and a half. We made 4 successive prototypes that have been all tested on children aged from 0 to 5 year old. Thanks to these workshops, we created a truly useful product that is cute and safe for children.

    Can it cause a choking hazard?

    No, there is no risk of the baby choking since all the materials and dimensions respect European and American standards, namely in accordance to CE and FCC certifications

    Is the battery dangerous?

    No, the battery is not removable; it is fully encapsulated in a shell, and is completely sealed to ensure there are no leaks or hazardous small parts.

    Is there an electrical shock hazard?

    Oliba meets the Low Voltage Directive of CE certification. This Directive shall in particular ensure electrical safety and is mandatory for children's fixtures.

    Are Oliba Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved?

    The current features built into Oliba do not require FDA approval.

    Is Oliba waterproof?

    Oliba is not waterproof but you can remove Oliba’s fabric for machine wash.

    TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS

    What’s the technology behind Oliba?

    Oliba uses the standardized and secure technology called Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE).

    Does the application work with all smartphones?

    Today, the app works on the following iOS devices: iPhone 6 Plus, iPhone 6, iPhone 5S, iPhone 5C, iPhone 5, iPhone 4S, iPad 3, iPad 4, iPad Air 2,iPad Air, iPad Mini 3, iPad Mini 2, iPad Mini, and iPod Touch 5G. We will support Android on selected devices by our reception date.

    Do I need an Internet connection? What type?

    Oliba doesn’t need Internet for regular use. You need a regular Internet connection with wife only when you want to upload new content.

    What if I don’t have a smartphone?

    Oliba will then only work partially. You can benefit from the pre-recorded light and audio sequences, but you won’t be able to customize your Oliba and locate the cuddly toy.

    Is there a web application?

    No, Oliba only works with a smartphone application.

    Can I use the App with multiple Oliba?

    Yes, we designed the application to support multiple Oliba.

    Can Oliba synchronize to more than one smartphone?

    Yes, we allow multiple phones to be connected with the Oliba. It enables all the family but also multiple caregivers to use the App to locate the cuddly toy or to add new content.

    Is the battery replaceable?

    No, the battery is encapsulated inside the sensor and is not removable or replaceable.

    Where is Oliba manufactured?

    Oliba is manufactured in China. Our manufacturing partners are ISO approved manufacturers and operate at the highest level of manufacturing and quality control standards. They already manufacture child products for several other well-known companies.

    DISTRIBUTION

    Where will Oliba be available?

    Initially we will be selling to the public directly online via our website. We are tough looking for strong distribution partners in many territories. Our priority is to cover Europe and the USA in 2016.

    When will Oliba be available?

    We plan to ship Oliba in June 2016. We will keep you posted on the expected delivery date of your order.

    CUSTOMER SUPPORT

    Is Oliba warrantied?

    Oliba is 1-year warranty, defective products may be returned to Oliba customer service.

    CROWDFUNDING

    Why does the price is labeled in US Dollars

    Prices are set in US Dollars because it is an international campaign.

    Are there any fees for US Dollars billing?

    If your bank account is not based in the United-States, fees may be applied for a payment in foreign currency and depends on your bank policy.

    Where can I pre-order Oliba and how long will it last?

    Pre-orders are launched on the crowdfunding site, www.indiegogo.com. It will last 35 days. Prices are set in US Dollars because it is an international campaign.

    When will I receive Oliba at home?

    If the campaign does not reach its goal, you will be refunded. If the campaign achieves its objective (about 700 pre-ordered Oliba) the project will be validated by Indiegogo. The funds will be used for the production and certification of the pre-ordered units. You will receive your Oliba six months after the end of the campaign.
story_txt:
Pour la page en Français, c'est par ici ! Oliba is a cute owl that you can tie to your child's cuddly toy that communicates with an App.

Never loose the cuddly toy again: Oliba is a smart babyproof cuddly toy tracker.

Share riveting stories that foster creativity: Oliba is a storyteller with endless imagination

Soothe your child to sleep: Oliba is a connected musical nightlight
      
 

 
 

 
                                        Click Here for English FAQ!Français       Oliba est une petite chouette qui s'attache à tous les doudous et communique avec son App.  
Fini le doudou perdu : Oliba est un retrouve doudou malin adapté aux enfants
Partagez des histoires passionnantes : Oliba est un raconteur d'histoires plein d'imagination
Aidez votre enfant à mieux dormir : Oliba est une veilleuse musicale sur mesure
                              
Pour remonter en haut de page et acheter c'est ici !            
---- FAQ FRANÇAIS---- SPECIFICATIONS PRODUIT     Qu’est-ce qu’Oliba ?  Oliba est le chouette complice des enfants et du doudou. Oliba s’attache à tous les doudous avec une attache universelle. Grâce à son application smartphone, Oliba est personnalisable pour s’adapter au développement des enfants de 0 à 5 ans.  Oliba est un retrouve doudou malin et une veilleuse musicale connectée, qui raconte des histoires pleine d’imagination pour développer la créativité de votre enfant.     A quoi peut me servir Oliba?  Parce qu’un dodo sans doudou c’est impossible, et parce que le doudou ne suffit pas toujours à s’endormir sereinement, Smarty Crew a développé Oliba.  Avec Oliba, vous ne perdrez plus le doudou, elle vous fait gagner du temps et de l’énergie.  Oliba vous permet de passer plus de temps avec votre enfant en partageant des histoires passionnantes : Elle connait de supers histoires de Radio Pomme d’Api pour tous les enfants de 0 à 5 ans.    Avec Oliba, aidez votre enfant à mieux dormir.      Comment marche Oliba ?  Oliba s'attache à tous les doudous et communique avec son App en toute sécurité.  Faites ululer Oliba avec l'App pour retrouver le doudou à la maison sans stress ni larmes. L'App vous alerte si le doudou est à plus de 30 mètres, et vous montre la dernière position connue du doudou.  Les enfants adorent les histoires. Elles les aident à grandir en développant leur imaginaire. Avec l’App, choisissez une histoire de la bibliothèque d'Oliba ou enregistrez votre voix, Oliba la racontera. Oliba connait de supers histoires de Radio Pomme d'Api pour tous les enfants de 0 à 5 ans. En deux clics, Oliba enregistre l'histoire de votre choix. Vous pouvez la démarrer avec l'App ou manuellement en appuyant quelques secondes sur le bec d'Oliba. Les enfants peuvent s'évader dans leur imaginaire et écouter votre voix partout et à tout moment, sans aucun téléphone ni aucune connexion.  Avec l'App, paramétrez une veilleuse et choisissez une berceuse dans la bibliothèque d'Oliba. Vous pouvez aussi enregistrer votre voix pour endormir votre enfant. Quand c'est l'heure de dormir, Oliba scintille dans le noir et chante la berceuse pour calmer et endormir votre enfant selon ses peurs et ses besoins. Démarrez-la avec l'App ou en appuyant brièvement sur le bec d'Oliba. N'importe qui peut démarrer manuellement la séquence, à la crèche ou à la maison, sans avoir besoin de l'App.      A partir de quel âge mon enfant peut utiliser Oliba ? Comment Oliba s’adapte à l’enfant ?   Oliba est la chouette complice des enfants de 0 à 5 ans car Oliba connait de supers histoires de Radio Pomme d'Api adaptées à l’âge de votre enfant. Vous pouvez aussi enregistrer votre propre voix.        Quel est le contenu disponible ? Comment avoir du nouveau contenu?   Oliba est livrée avec 10 berceuses et 10 histoires (5 en langue française et 5 en langue anglaise). Elles sont fournies et sélectionnées par Radio Pomme d’Api. Du nouveau contenu sera proposé directement depuis l’application une fois commercialisée.    Où et quand puis-je télécharger l’application ?  Quand vous recevrez votre Oliba, rendez-vous sur l’Apple Store et sur Google Play pour télécharger gratuitement l’application Oliba.   Quelles fonctionnalités existent sur l’application Oliba ?  Grâce à l’application, vous pouvez faire ululer Oliba et localiser le doudou. Vous pouvez personnaliser les lumières, les histoires et les berceuses en fonction des goûts de votre enfant. Vous pouvez aussi enregistrer vos propres histoires.  Est-ce qu’Oliba peut se décrocher de la peluche ?  L’attache universelle d’Oliba a été conçue pour qu’une fois attachée, Oliba ne puisse pas être retirée par un enfant.   En quelle couleur sera disponible Oliba ?   Un sondage sera réalisé après la clôture de la campagne de crowdfunding pour que vous puissiez voter pour votre couleur préférée. Oliba sera livrée dans le jeu de couleur ayant reçu le plus de votes.     En quelle langue est disponible Oliba ?   Oliba est livrée avec des berceuses et histoires en langue française et anglaise. L’application sera disponible en français et anglais.  Quelles données collecte Oliba ? Quelle est votre politique de confidentialité ?  Nous ne collectons aucune donnée personnelle. Nous avons fait le choix de respecter les enfants, et ainsi votre vie de famille.   Oliba analyse uniquement les informations concernant les chansons et histoires (types et durées) afin de vous offrir dans le futur du contenu adapté.  Vous pouvez consulter notre politique de confidentialité en cliquant sur ce lien.  SECURITE ET CERTIFICATION     Qu’en est-il des ondes ?   Oliba et son App communiquent en Bluetooth 4.0. C'est le protocole de communication le plus léger qui existe aujourd'hui.  Oliba est passive, c'est avant tout un récepteur. Elle n'envoie aucune donnée au téléphone et n’émet qu’un signal de présence, bien plus faible qu’un SMS.  La connexion avec le smartphone peut être coupée à l'aide d'un bouton. Comme Oliba enregistre dans sa mémoire réglages et contenus, les fonctions histoire, veilleuse et berceuse fonctionnent même quand la connexion est coupée!  De quoi est fabriqué Oliba? Oliba contient-il des phtalates, du Bisphénol A ou d’autres composants toxiques ?  Oliba est composée de plastiques doux au toucher et de textiles utilisés pour les doudous : coton, ratine de velours, microfibre… Les matières d’Oliba sont conformes aux dispositions européennes sur le Bisphénol A et les phtalates pour les articles de puériculture destinés aux enfants de moins de 3 ans, et Oliba sera livrée en étant conformes aux certifications CE et FCC. Conformément à la Directive européenne ROHS, aucune substance dangereuse n’est présente dans les produits destinés aux enfants mais aussi dans les packagings.  Le produit convient-il aux peaux sensibles ?  Bien sûr, Oliba est doux pour la peau délicate de bébé. Tous les matériaux ont été testés et répondent aux normes européennes et américaines, notamment les certifications CE et FCC.  Avez-vous déjà testé le produit ? Avec des bébés ?  Oliba a été entièrement conçue avec plus de 150 familles, pendant plus d’un an et demi. Nous avons réussi à réaliser 4 prototypes qui ont tous été testés sur des enfants entre 0 et 5 ans. Grâce à ces ateliers de travail, nous avons crée un produit vraiment utile, qui est à la fois mignon et sur pour les enfants.  Y-a-t’il un risque d‘étranglement?  Non, il n’y a pas de risque d’étranglement car l’ensemble des composants et de leurs dimensions respectent les standards européens et américains, notamment en accord avec les certifications CE et FCC.  La batterie est-elle dangereuse ?  Non, pas plus qu’une autre batterie Lithium. Elle n’est pas amovible, est entièrement encapsulée dans une coque métallique et est complètement étanche pour qu'il n'y ait pas de fuites ou de petites pièces dangereuses.  Y a-t-il un risque électrique ?  Oliba répond à la Directive sur la Basse Tension. Cette Directive s'assure notamment de la sécurité électrique et est obligatoire pour les luminaires pour enfants.  Est-ce qu’Oliba est homologué par la FDA,  l’Agence Américaine des produits alimentaires et médicamenteux?   Les caractéristiques d’Oliba n’exigent pas d’homologation par la FDA.   Est-ce qu’Oliba est résistant à l’eau ?   Oliba n’est pas imperméable mais vous pouvez passer sa housse à la machine à laver.   SPECIFICATIONS TECHNIQUES  Avec quelle technologie fonctionne Oliba ?   Oliba fonctionne avec le standard Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE), une technologie sécurisée.   Est-ce que l’application fonctionne avec tous les smartphones?   Aujourd’hui, l’application fonctionne sur les produits iOS : iPhone 6 Plus, iPhone 6, iPhone 5S, iPhone 5C, iPhone 5, iPhone 4S, iPad 3, iPad 4, iPad Air 2,iPad Air, iPad Mini 3, iPad Mini 2, iPad Mini et iPod Touch 5G.   La compatibilité avec certains terminaux Android sera assurée d’ici la date de réception d’Oliba.   Faut-il internet pour utiliser Oliba ?   Oliba n’a pas besoin d’internet pour fonctionner. Vous avez uniquement besoin d’une connexion wifi quand vous voulez télécharger de nouveaux contenus pour Oliba.  Que faire si je n’ai pas de smartphone ?   Oliba fonctionnera mais partiellement. Vous pourrez utiliser le contenu présent dans Oliba mais ne pourrez pas personnaliser Oliba ni la localiser avec le doudou.   Y a-t-il une application web?  Non, Oliba ne fonctionne qu’avec une application smartphone.   Puis-je utiliser l’application avec plusieurs Oliba ?  Oui, nous avons conçu l’application pour qu’elle soit compatible avec plusieurs Oliba.        Est-ce qu’Oliba peut se synchroniser à plusieurs Smartphones?  Oui, nous avons autorisé la connexion d’Oliba à plusieurs Smartphones. Cela  permet à toute la famille mais aussi au personnel de la crèche ou à la baby-sitter de retrouver le doudou ou d’ajouter du nouveau contenu à Oliba.  Est-ce que je peux changer la batterie?   Non, la batterie est encapsulée à l’intérieur d’Oliba pour la sécurité des enfants. Elle ne peut donc pas être remplacée.   Où est fabriquée Oliba ?   Oliba est fabriquée en Chine. Nos partenaires fabricants sont certifiés ISO et respectent le plus haut niveau des standards de production et de contrôle qualité. Ils fabriquent déjà des produits pour enfants pour plusieurs grandes marques.   DISTRIBUTION  Où est disponible Oliba ?   Oliba sera tout d’abord vendue directement depuis notre site internet. De plus, nous cherchons de forts partenariats de distribution. Nos priorités géographiques pour 2016 sont l’Europe et les Etats-Unis.  Quand Oliba sera disponible ?   Nous prévoyons de livrer Oliba en Juin 2016. Nous vous tiendrons au courant le plus tôt possible de ​​la date de livraison prévue de votre commande.           SUPPORT CLIENT     Oliba est-elle garantie ?    Oliba est garantie 1 an, les produits défectueux pourront être renvoyés à notre service client.            CAMPAGNE DE CROWDFUNDING     Pourquoi  le prix s’affiche-t-il en dollars ?   Les prix seront fixés en dollars car c’est une campagne internationale.     Y’a t’il des frais liés à la facturation en Dollars ?  Des frais peuvent s’appliquer à un achat en devise étrangère. Ces frais dépendent de votre banque.       Où et pendant combien de temps pourrais-je précommander Oliba ? Oliba should not come loose because its fastener has been manufactured to resist the children strength.  In what colors is Oliba available?   A survey will be conducted after the crowdfunding campaign for you to vote for your favorite colors. Oliba will be delivered with the color play that received the most votes.  In what language is Oliba available ?  Oliba is delivered with English and French lullabies and stories. The App will be available in English and French.  What kind of information does Oliba gather? What’s our privacy policy?    We don’t collect any personal data. It is our choice to respect children and family personal lives. Oliba only analyses information about the songs and stories that you play (types and durations) to offer you adapted content in the future.   SAFETY AND CERTIFICATION  What about signal or radio technology used in Oliba?  Oliba and its app communicate by Bluetooth 4.0. It is the lightest communication protocol invented today. Oliba is passive, it is a receiver. Meaning that it does not send any data to the phone and emits only a signal of presence, much lower than a SMS. The connection to the smartphone can be turned off with a button on Oliba. As Oliba storessettings and content, the functionalities of lullaby, storytelling and nightlight and can be used even when the connection is deactivated!  What is Oliba made of?  Oliba is made with a soft-touch plastic and cuddly toy-textiles (cotton, terry velour, microfiber plush…). Oliba will be delivered after CE and FCC certifications. Particularly Oliba’s materials comply with European rules on Biphenyl A and phthalates in childcare articles intended for children less than 3 years. In accordance with European ROHS Directive, hazardous substances are not present in products intended for children but either in packaging.  Is it safe for delicate skin?  Absolutely, Oliba is fully gentle on baby’s delicate skin. All the materials have been tested to and pass the European and American standards, namely CE and FCC certifications.  What about product testing? Have you tested Oliba with babies?  Oliba has been fully co-developed with over 150 families during more than a year and a half. We made 4 successive prototypes that have been all tested on children aged from 0 to 5 year old. Thanks to these workshops, we created a truly useful product that is cute and safe for children.  Can it cause a choking hazard?  No, there is no risk of the baby choking since all the materials and dimensions respect European and American standards, namely in accordance to CE and FCC certifications   Is the battery dangerous?  No, the battery is not removable; it is fully encapsulated in a shell, and is completely sealed to ensure there are no leaks or hazardous small parts.  Is there an electrical shock hazard?  Oliba meets the Low Voltage Directive of CE certification. This Directive shall in particular ensure electrical safety and is mandatory for children's fixtures.  Are Oliba Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved?  The current features built into Oliba do not require FDA approval.  Is Oliba waterproof?  Oliba is not waterproof but you can remove Oliba’s fabric for machine wash.  TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS  What’s the technology behind Oliba?  Oliba uses the standardized and secure technology called Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE).  Does the application work with all smartphones?  Today, the app works on the following iOS devices: iPhone 6 Plus, iPhone 6, iPhone 5S, iPhone 5C, iPhone 5, iPhone 4S, iPad 3, iPad 4, iPad Air 2,iPad Air, iPad Mini 3, iPad Mini 2, iPad Mini, and iPod Touch 5G. We will support Android on selected devices by our reception date.  Do I need an Internet connection? What type?   Oliba doesn’t need Internet for regular use. You need a regular Internet connection with wife only when you want to upload new content.  What if I don’t have a smartphone?  Oliba will then only work partially. You can benefit from the pre-recorded light and audio sequences, but you won’t be able to customize your Oliba and locate the cuddly toy.   Is there a web application?  No, Oliba only works with a smartphone application.   Can I use the App with multiple Oliba?  Yes, we designed the application to support multiple Oliba.   Can Oliba synchronize to more than one smartphone?  Yes, we allow multiple phones to be connected with the Oliba. It enables all the family but also multiple caregivers to use the App to locate the cuddly toy or to add new content.  Is the battery replaceable?   No, the battery is encapsulated inside the sensor and is not removable or replaceable.  Where is Oliba manufactured?  Oliba is manufactured in China. Our manufacturing partners are ISO approved manufacturers and operate at the highest level of manufacturing and quality control standards. They already manufacture child products for several other well-known companies.   DISTRIBUTION  Where will Oliba be available?  Initially we will be selling to the public directly online via our website. We are tough looking for strong distribution partners in many territories. Our priority is to cover Europe and the USA in 2016.  When will Oliba be available?  We plan to ship Oliba in June 2016. We will keep you posted on the expected delivery date of your order.  CUSTOMER SUPPORT  Is Oliba warrantied?   Oliba is 1-year warranty, defective products may be returned to Oliba customer service.  CROWDFUNDING  Why does the price is labeled in US Dollars   Prices are set in US Dollars because it is an international campaign.   Are there any fees for US Dollars billing?   If your bank account is not based in the United-States, fees may be applied for a payment in foreign currency and depends on your bank policy.  Where can I pre-order Oliba and how long will it last?   Pre-orders are launched on the crowdfunding site, www.indiegogo.com. It will last 35 days. Prices are set in US Dollars because it is an international campaign.   When will I receive Oliba at home?   If the campaign does not reach its goal, you will be refunded. If the campaign achieves its objective (about 700 pre-ordered Oliba) the project will be validated by Indiegogo. The funds will be used for the production and certification of the pre-ordered units. You will receive your Oliba six months after the end of the campaign.

story:
What is the Bottle Blocker?

Two of the biggest problems facing parents with teenaged kids today are: Underage drinking and prescription drug abuse. The Bottle Blocker helps you prevent both these problems in your home, the only place where you have any control.

My name is Richard Michiel, and I am the inventor of the Bottle Blocker. The Bottle Blocker is a patent-pending tamper proof locking device that fits on any liquor bottle or pill bottle to prevent unauthorized access.

The product was created in response to the staggering numbers of injuries and deaths that occur each year as a result of underage drinking. Alcohol is the most commonly used and abused drug among youth in the United States, more than tobacco and illicit drugs, and is responsible for more than 4,700 annual deaths among youth. Although drinking by persons under the age of 21 is illegal, people aged 12 to 20 years drink 11% of all alcohol consumed in the United States. In 2010, there were approximately 189,000 emergency rooms visits by persons under age 21 for injuries and other conditions linked to alcohol. The 2011 Youth Risk Behavior Survey found that among high school students, during the past 30 days: 39% drank some amount of alcohol; 22% binge drank; and 8% drove after drinking alcohol.

“Most kids get their first taste of alcohol from their parent’s liquor cabinet,” says LICADD (Long Island Council on Alcohol and Drug Addiction) Executive Director Dr. Jeffrey L. Reynolds. “Parents who use Bottle Blocker will send a clear message to their kids that they won’t tolerate underage drinking and violation of the device will give them the opportunity to address alcohol abuse before it spirals into a more serious problem. With increased enforcement of social host laws and the advent of summer parties, parents need to act affirmatively to both protect their kids and limit their liability.”

The simple two-piece device fits on any bottle with a neck, first with a custom latex cap that covers the bottle cap, and is then secured with a custom cable tie. The ties come in a custom color with an imprinted logo to make them difficult to replace. The Bottle Blocker can also be used on pill bottles – ensuring that prescriptions are safe and out of children’s hands.

I am working on a New Improved version of the Bottle Blocker. As great as the response to the original Bottle Blocker was I am making it even better! By adding a different serial number on each tie that will make it impossible to replace without getting caught, and adding a log sheet that will track where each lock was used which will prevent a kid from taking an entire bottle we can save even more lives.

Once we get our new improved ties, we need to start an advertising campaign to get it out and do something to change the statistics facing our youth and hopefully save some lives. That’s where you come in, we need funds to start a campaign to make people aware that we are here to help, and that we can make a difference.

What We Need and Why

I am trying to raise $15,000 to start an advertising campaign to create some brand awareness and let people know that there is a better way to deal with this age-old problem than just talking to our kids.

The Impact

Help me make a difference. I know this product is important to parents as well as their kids. We can save some lives. We can change the statistics and show our kids in a very strong way that we want them to be safe, we want them to make better decisions, and we do not want them drinking our alcohol or taking our pills.

This is such a simple solution, yet no one has come up with anything like it before. Its inexpensive, simple to use, and with your help we will make a difference.

Other Ways You Can Help

OK, so you saw my campaign, you like the idea, see the value, but you just don't have the funds to help us in that way. I understand, there is still a way to help get this product out and it doesn't cost a penny. Spread the word, help me make people aware that we exist and that finally you can do more than just talk to your kids about underage drinking and prescription drug abuse at home. Tell your facebook friends, twitter connections and your local PTA about our campaign so that others can help us reach our goals.

You can also use the indigogo share tools to get the message out.

story:
TeamJonny!

Hi! I'm Cami and I'm fundraising for my six year old cousin, Jonny. He was diagnosed with Pre-B Acute Lymphocyctic Leukemia on August 20th, 2013. This little boy is the light of my life. He's my everything. And while there isn't much I can do because this is not a "boo-boo" that I can kiss and make better, I can at least do this.

So I'm raising money to help my aunt and uncle (who have been like second parents to me) with whatever they need. We don't know yet how long he will be in and out of the hospital. We do know that treatments will continue for the next three years.

What I need:

Some more details:

  • My goal is $1000 or more. It won't cover much, but it's still help. The money will go to my aunt and uncle.
  • Whether it's $10 or $10,000, all donations will go to the Hendricks family.

The Impact

Your donations may not seem like much, but they're everything:

  • I feel helpless knowing that there's nothing I can do to make this better. But if I can do this one little thing, to take some stress off them, they'll be in better moods and Jonny will be in a better mood which is key to recovery.
  • I need him to beat this. My whole family does. He's a fighter in every sense of the word. I'm just trying to make the fight as easy as possible for him.

Other Ways You Can Help!

Even if you can't donate, there's still things you can do!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign! Tell your friends, family, co-workers, or anyone!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools too!

Thank you!

story:
The Competitor

Elise Colleen Yates is a serious competitor, and her sport is bowling. As a 16 year old sophomore, Elise has already accomplished a great deal. (A list of some of her achievements is included below.) Her determination and drive to win are evident to everyone who knows her, and her skill and smooth game play are the results of thousands of hours and several years of practice and hard work. Until now, however, the only tournaments she has been able to participate in have been local (Washington and Oregon) and have been paid for, out of pocket, by us (her parents). For bowling, tournaments are where a player makes their name and gets noticed. Unfortunately, we don't really have the income to afford for Elise to test her skills at any of the larger national events, which would give her better scholarship prizes, greater exposure to potential college scouts, and competition experience.

Elise has worked hard and is already a great bowler, but she is constantly striving to improve her skill level and mental game, and in order for her to reach the next level, she needs to be able to participate in national competitions. We are asking for your help to get Elise to her first major tournament: the 2014 Bowling.com Youth Open, which takes place this June in Lakewood, California. In order for her to compete, she's going to need your support!



What You Can Do

The most important gift we can give is that which helps a child achieve his or her dreams. Unfortunately, not all kids are able to pursue their goals due to financial handicaps. While some do not have to worry about paying for what they need to succeed, others have to reach out to the community for support.

They say that it takes a village to raise a child, and it is this village that we are asking to help Elise be able to travel to a very important tournament for her career. Any amount that you can donate is greatly appreciated, and by supporting this young athlete, we can take great pride in her future accomplishments!

The Details

The Youth Open is a USBC certified tournament, and Elise will bowl in the singles and doubles divisions. The tournament is in Lakewood, CA, and takes place June 21 and 22, 2014. Travel expenses (transportation, hotel, food) and entry fees come to approximately $2,890.00, (which is definitely more than an optician and an writing instructor can afford to pay.) However, as Elise plans to continue her bowling career into college, the potential scholarship awards, the exposure to college scouts, and the experience of bowling in a fiercely competitive environment are essential elements of achieving her goal.

The funds raised by this campaign will go towards covering travel expenses and entry fees (for Elise and her doubles partner.) We are NOT including time off of work in the proposed amount, only the expenses directly related to tournament participation. Any additional funds that we raise will go towards other tournaments, coaching costs, and equipment expenses, and believe me, as much as this girl bowls, maintaining her gear can get expensive!

The Perks

What will you get for donating? The most important thing you will get for donating to Elise's campaign is the knowledge that you have helped a young athlete to reach her fullest potential. BUT! As we are living in a material world (and you may or may not be a material girl) we realize that fancy, additional perks may help sweeten the pot!

For $5 or more, your name will be added to the list of supporters at the "Help Elise Yates to Compete" Facebook page, and you will also receive profuse amounts of positive energy and psychic thanks from her entire support team.

For $25 or more, in addition to the $5 perk, Elise will also add your name to a tournament shirt and take a photo, wearing the shirt, which will be posted on the Facebook page. As new names are added to the shirt, we will retake the photo and update the Facebook page every week or two, until the campaign has ended.

For $50 or more, in addition to the previous perks, you will be mailed a hand-made postcard, designed by Elise's father (Richard F. Yates) and signed by Elise herself! (Autographed, if you will! Get them while they're still cheap!)

For $100 or more, you will be mailed not one, not two, but THREE hand-made postcards, designed by Elise's father (still Richard F. Yates) and signed by Elise herself, shipped to you at the rate of approximately one per month starting in June. Everyone likes getting something fun in the mail, right?

Now for the big spenders, for $250 or more, along with the other perks, you will be shipped an original, canvas painting (approximately 16" x 20") by Elise's father (and believe it or not, his work has actually been sold in galleries.) These paintings will be created after the campaign is over, shipped at our expense, and will be accompanied by a hand written letter of thanks from Elise Yates, and a donation of this amount will inspire our undying gratitude! (Only one painting per supporter, please!) [ALERT: there is 90-95% chance it will contain monsters, ghosts, or robots!]

If you can't afford to donate any money, and we can certainly sympathize, you can still help Elise by spreading word of her campaign far and wide! As her parents, we naturally want to see her succeed, and with your help, I'm certain that we can help her achieve her goals! 

The Accomplishments

At sixteen years old, Elise has already made a name for herself in the Northwest. She is the varsity anchor for her high school bowling team and has been named MVP for the team for two years in a row. She was recently voted a WIAA State Athlete of the Week, was chosen First Team All State for the 2013/2014 school year, and was voted Bowler of the Year by the Greater St. Helens Girls High School Bowling League. She has received a USBC honor award for 11 strikes in a row during tournament play (a 290 game), carries a 204 average in her weekly league, and has won or placed in dozens of local tournaments in Washington and Oregon, including taking 2nd place at the 2013 Triangle Bowl Junior Masters, despite bowling the final SIX GAMES of the tournament with a thumb that had torn open and was bleeding.

In spring of 2013, she took 2nd place in the state finals for the Pepsi Youth Tournament, and was offered a spot in the North Point Junior Gold conference, one of the most important youth tournaments in the country, but we had to decline the invitation, primarily because of our inability to pay the travel costs to get her to Detroit. This year, we want to make sure she doesn't miss the opportunity to participate in any other important tournaments.

Elise is strong-minded and strong-willed. All she needs to succeed are the tools of her profession and the opportunity to compete. She can do the rest! Thanks!

---Richard and Mariah Yates ("Dad" and "Mom")


(Below are two examples of a recent Richard F. Yates canvas paintings.)

story:
Short Summary


WHO AM I?

   I, Cliff Franks, founder of Hoop Jargon, have a vested interest in the health and recovery of Dwight Jones, a true American and local hero. Like Dwight I too am a Houston product that overcame tremendous adversity from a social economically disadvantaged part of town (Acres Homes) to make quite a name for myself in basketball both collegiately at Prairie View A&M University and in Europe professionally. A lot of people raised in the inner city don't have the chances and advantages as others, so it takes a great deal of personal perseverance to overcome such odds and avoid the perils of street life. Through hard work and determination Dwight was beaten the odds and earned the respect of his peers at the University of Houston, The NBA, and Europe and most famously as a member of the 1972 USA Olympic Bronze Medal Team (who infamously lost under questionable circumstances to the Soviet Union). 


Dwight playing in the 1972 Olympics



MORE ABOUT DWIGHT...

   Dwight got ejected that game for a fight, but this bout with a life threatening blood clot proved to be a tougher one. Dwight has personally helped me in starting my first business, buying my first car, as well as coached me to be a better basketball player, so I am obliged to help him in his time of need.

Dwight as a Los Angeles Laker


WHY IT'S IMPORTANT TO HELP THE JONES FAMILY

   Contributions will go directly to his family to assist with his recovery and rehabilitation process of having his leg and foot amputated. The whole Jones family is going through a challenge with this situation financially and emotionally, so I wanted Big D to know I as well as others who appreciate his lifetime work.  We have the goal of raising $1000 to present to the Jones family, but are more than happy with whatever we can achieve. Let’s show our home town hero that Houston truly does care about their own!

Dwight's story has been featured on the local Houston news, and as a former Houston Rocket, I'd love for the organization to help to reach out in this effort!


Dwight as a Houston Rocket



PLEASE Contact me via Email or phone for any questions or concerns! 

cfranks11@ymail.com 

713-518-2267


Please share this incredible story to all of your friends via blog, Facebook, twitter, etc.!!
story_txt:
Short Summary
WHO AM I?   I, Cliff Franks, founder of Hoop Jargon, have a vested interest in the health and recovery of Dwight Jones, a true American and local hero. Like Dwight I too am a Houston product that overcame tremendous adversity from a social economically disadvantaged part of town (Acres Homes) to make quite a name for myself in basketball both collegiately at Prairie View A&M University and in Europe professionally. A lot of people raised in the inner city don't have the chances and advantages as others, so it takes a great deal of personal perseverance to overcome such odds and avoid the perils of street life. Through hard work and determination Dwight was beaten the odds and earned the respect of his peers at the University of Houston, The NBA, and Europe and most famously as a member of the 1972 USA Olympic Bronze Medal Team (who infamously lost under questionable circumstances to the Soviet Union). 

Dwight playing in the 1972 OlympicsMORE ABOUT DWIGHT...   Dwight got ejected that game for a fight, but this bout with a life threatening blood clot proved to be a tougher one. Dwight has personally helped me in starting my first business, buying my first car, as well as coached me to be a better basketball player, so I am obliged to help him in his time of need. Dwight as a Los Angeles LakerWHY IT'S IMPORTANT TO HELP THE JONES FAMILY
   Contributions will go directly to his family to assist with his recovery and rehabilitation process of having his leg and foot amputated. The whole Jones family is going through a challenge with this situation financially and emotionally, so I wanted Big D to know I as well as others who appreciate his lifetime work.  We have the goal of raising $1000 to present to the Jones family, but are more than happy with whatever we can achieve. Let’s show our home town hero that Houston truly does care about their own! 
Dwight's story has been featured on the local Houston news, and as a former Houston Rocket, I'd love for the organization to help to reach out in this effort!Dwight as a Houston RocketPLEASE Contact me via Email or phone for any questions or concerns! cfranks11@ymail.com

story:
Who We Are

Bright Hollow Medicinals is a queer, anarchist herbal and art based medicinal practice. We approach health and care through a synthesis of traditional herbal medicinal practice and a psychic, magic, and spiritual one. We attempt to create art, medicine and relationships that are born of love, patience, and acknowledgement of the simultaneous fragility and strength of the human body. We seek to explore and illuminate the complex interweavings of human ecology and wild ecology, to be better equipped for stewarding the bright and open world we have been given. We find this world in ourselves, each other, our friends and clients, and the wilderness.

Bright Hollow seeks to dissolve the false boundaries imposed on all ecologies (on all scales of wilderness, both human and forest) by capitalism and the language of commodity. We seek to cultivate expansive understandings of human potential and responsibility, and insist on the value and importance of generating rooted, individual, powerful, and personal relationships with the wild.






What We're Doing

We are currently in the process of starting up medicinal gardens of our own. We are looking to do this in a variety of ways and places. A relatively expansive garden is being planned out at Brook's Bend farm in Montague, where Cea lives. We would also like to plant various natives and endangered plants in the woods around us, for harvesting but also in hopes of supporting threatened plants due to development and over harvesting.

Cea has begun to focus more specifically on herbal support for transgender and gender nonconforming health as well as mental health and healing from trauma and seeks to cultivate these spaces in a way that allows them to reflect human and wild processes; that like plants, we experience growth, thirst, setting down roots, digging them up, periods of vibrance and silence. These places will exist not only as gardens but as places of healing, for consultations, for laughter, crying, insanity and growth. We seek to share these spaces with others in a way that is supportive, educational and informative by not only giving medicine and information, but through storytelling and introducing people to the plants themselves, allowing others to make informed decisions for themselves.


What We Need

Most of our current costs are for seeds and plants, but we also need bottles, jars, alcohol for tincture making, packaging supplies, etc. Whatever funding we don't use immediately will go into the Bright Hollow fund to help with supplies in the future.

If you can't help monetarily, there are other ways to support us! If you have extra seeds, are in Massachusetts and want to help build beds, weed and harvest, are an alcohol (organic grain) supplier, or have extra bottles and jars, we can use them!

story:
What We Need 

Hunter, one of my co-workers was recently blessed with a second baby girl. Unfortunately, baby Devny has been diagnosed with a MSPI, a milk/soy protein intolerance. She is only able to eat a special type of formula, Similac Alementum, that is very expensive.  

  • I'm hoping that people can contribute money to help Hunter's family buy more of this special formula. 
  • All the funds will go directly to Hunter.

The Impact

Hunter's family is spending $10 a day, $300 a month on this formula. 12 months of formula would be $3,600. Even a $5 donation will help tremendously. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you or anyone you know has similac coupons please mail them to:

Attn: Hunter 

5960 S 57th St, Lincoln, NE 68516

Who I am

  • My name is Andrea Smolin and I'm a project manager on the Mortgage team at Zillow.
  • This is important to me because I'd love to be able to help a fellow co-worker. 
Disclaimer
This was started by myself and funded mostly by co-workers as a thoughtful thing to do.

story:
Why this project?

Dear Donors,

It is very important to me that you know the story behind Tennis For a Better Life Foundation and the reason for what we are doing. Many years ago, as a young boy in a small town in Benin Africa, I (Paul) was given a racquet and a tennis ball. Little did I know these two things were going to be my ticket to a better life. At the age of nine, I was offered a tennis and education  scholarship to come to the United States and train at a Tennis Academy. I was also took in by the most loving family. After traveling and participating in many tournaments including representing my country in the Davis Cup, at the age of eighteen I decided to pursue a college education. I received a full tennis scholarship to Palm Beach Atlantic University, and earned my B.S degree. Today, I am using a tennis racquet and tennis ball to earn my living. 

 To give back  the same opportunity that was giving to me to other children,   My team and I  started tennis for a better life, a 501 c 3 foundation. We took a trip to Benin, Africa this past August 2014. Before going, We collected used tennis equipment such as racquets, balls, shoes, clothing and tennis bags and took them with us to Cotonou, Benin Africa. Benin  is one of the poorest country in west Africa. In  Benin, there are two popular sports. Children  either play  soccer  or tennis. While there, my team and I had the opportunity to run a tennis tournament for the children, distributed the equipment, fed the children and give away prizes.

Our hearts were filled with compassion for these children who were extremely talented, hungry and passionate about the game of tennis, but had no hope that it could take then anywhere in life or take them out of poverty.  Most of them were playing barefoot. The court they were playing on had cracks everywhere and the nets were very old and had holes. The two post that holds the net up were all rusty and unsafe. What we saw in Benin, Africa and the condition in which children are playing under, We decided to do more. We spoke to the Benin Tennis Federation directors and they give us the okay to come in and resurface the old tennis courts and build new courts for the children. These are the very courts I learned to play tennis on 20 years ago! 

Being in Africa and spending time with the children made us realize how lucky we are to be living in America. Here in the United States, we have tennis courts at almost every city park, school and community and many times you will find the courts are in great shape, but very empty. These children in Cotonou, Benin Africa love the game of tennis but lack everything we take for granted here in the states. Our foundation is providing the equipment for them now, we want to resurface one old tennis court and build two more for the children. One these courts we would continue to fed and give free tennis clinics, run tournaments, and provide education scholarships to our tournament winners, but in order to do this, we need your help. Your contribution can help us tremendously. Help us give children a chance at a better life through tennis. Thank You! All your contribution are tax deductible.

What We Need 

1. We are raising $80,000 for our project of resurfacing one old tennis court  and build two new courts.

2. Purchase new nets and replace old ones

3. Build a water fountain by the courts.

4 Run a weekly clinics

5. Share the Gospel of Jesus Christ

6. Provide hot meal to  210 children who will participate

 What You Get

1.  Donations of $50 you will receive:

-A tax deductible letter from our foundation via email.

-Constant updates of the project via email.

2.  Donations of $100 you will receive:

- A tax deductible letter from our foundation  in the mail.

 -Constant updates of the project via email.

3.  Donations of $250 will receive:

-A mention on our wesite www.tennisforabetterlife.org ( for you or your business) as a sponsor on the Australian Open Sponsor page.

 -A tax deductible letter via mail from Tennis for Better Life Foundation.

  -Constant updates of the project via email.

4. Donations of $1000 you will receive:

-A mention on  our website www.tennisforabetterlife.org on our French Open Sponsor page ( for you or your business)

- If you have a business your logo will be be posted on our website for three months.

-Constant updates of the project via email.

5. Donations of $2500 you will receive a mention on  our website www.tennisforabetterlife.org on our Wimbledon Sponsor page ( for you or your business).

-Tax Deductible letter via mail from tennis for a Better Life Foundation.

-If you have a business your logo will be be posted on our website for six  months.

-Constant updates of the project and picture of the participants children via email,

6.  Donations of $5000 you will receive a mention on  our website www.tennisforabetterlife.org on our Wimbledon Sponsor page ( for you or your business).

 -Tax Deductible letter via mail from tennis for a Better Life Foundation.

-If you have a business your logo will be be posted on our website for one year.

-Constant updates of the project and a frames picture of the participants children via mail.


    The Impact

    The difference you are making with your donations will have an everlasting impact. For some of these children being able to play tennis is an escape. It also gives them a chance of earning an educational scholarship which is an opportunity of a lifetime! This game/ tennis gives hope to many of these children a hope for a better future.  I am a product of that hope. Many years ago  someone came to Africa and gave me this hope with a tennis and an education, these two things have changed my life forever. What your donation does goes way beyond the court. 

      Other Ways You Can Help

      We understand that not everyone can contribute financially, but we all can help in some way. Our foundation is always collecting tennis equipment and clothing. If you would like to hold a racquet drive please contact us. We are also looking for a volunteer grant writer. If you  are able to help, please contact us.

      Some other ways you can help:

      •  Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
      • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

      ON BEHALF OF THE CHILDREN AND OUR TEAM HERE AT TENNIS FOR A BETTER LIFE FOUNDATION, WE WANT TO THANK YOU SO MUCH IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR TIME, DONATIONS AND SUPPORT.

story:
This is a $41,977 Rotary Peru Water Global Grant, which will help to supply clean drinking water in the community of Chaquira. We need an additional $5,000, so we are asking for your support.

What is unique about a  Rotary Grant is that every tax deductible dollar donated has the opportunity to grow to $3.50 because of the Rotary Matching Program.

 We are very fortunate to have as our Partner a fantastic NGO, Water Missions International. 

What's The Plan?

Community Managed Safe Water Project

Water Missions Peru uses a community-managed Safe Water Project Model to facilitate transformational change in Chaquira, Peru, while attacking relational strongholds of the poverty cycle. This transformational change occurs through sustainable safe water, sanitation and hygiene education practices. The projects longevity is supported by a financial plan that accounts for ongoing operational and equipment replacement costs. The foundation for all of these components is a stable management structure – the safe water committee (SWC).


1.  Community Mobilization:

·  This community-led meeting is the formal introduction of Rotary and Water Missions Peru to the entire community. The project objectives and the expectations of each party are discussed and documented in formal memorandum of understanding (MOU).

2.  Safe Water Committee Training:

·  Our Safe Water Committee training is broken into different sessions. The trainings concentrate on roles and responsibilities, the formation of a constitution to establish the governing as well as the financial sustainability aspects of the ongoing operation, money handling and accountability.

3.  Water, Sanitation and Hygiene Promotion: 

·  WASH (water, sanitation and hygiene) awareness training is conducted for all local leaders to help engage community support for the project. Volunteer WASH promoters then conduct (4) promotion cycles in the community:

  i.  Cycle 1: Water Usage & Contamination

  ii.  Cycle 2: Water Treatment & Storage

  iii.  Cycle 3: Hygiene Practices

  iv.  Cycle 4: Sanitation

Community Provided Sweat Equity:

Community equity is required for every project. Only after the community’s investment is confirmed will Water Missions Peru bring water treatment equipment to the community for installation. There are opportunities in every project for the community to invest. Examples of community equity include supplying materials for construction, financial investment, and the provision of skilled and unskilled labor support during construction activities.



Installation of Water Treatment Equipment:

Water Missions Peru brings in water treatment equipment specifically selected or designed for the community. Once installed, Water Missions Peru conducts a detailed operator training session. After this process the water system is commissioned and safe water flows into the community.


Post Commissioning Follow-Up & Support:

Work in the community does not end once a project is commissioned. Water Missions Peru provides a minimum of one year of follow-up and support. During that period, Water Missions Peru monitors the technical operation and verifies water quality, along with monitoring the reliability and work of the SWC. A typical project’s implementation period can last three to eighteen months. This is a safe water project, meaning we meet World Health Organization standards for safe water that is free of all microbiological contaminants. We won’t settle for simply ‘improved’water, which may still contain harmful contaminates.




About Water Missions International

Water Missions International is a nonprofit Christian engineering organization providing sustainable safe water and sanitation solutions for people in developing countries and disaster areas. Using state-of-the-art technology and engineering expertise, the organization has provided access to safe water for more than 2.5 million people in 50 countries on five continents since 2001. Water Missions International implements customized solutions through a comprehensive community development model in its ten permanent country programs in Africa, Asia, Latin America and the Caribbean.

Notably, Charity Navigator has awarded Water Missions International their top rating eight years in a row, a distinction shared by only one percent of the charities rated by the organization. To learn more about Water Missions International, visit www.watermissions.org. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides supporting the project financially, you can share this campaign with your friends on Facebook.

You can also send personal email to your closest friends.

You can get your Rotary Club to make a pledge in support of the Grant.

You can do a Painting Fundraiser. Take a look at this site.

     http://georgelewis.fineartstudioonline.com/

story:
That's me speaking at my "Fighting to Live" presentation on LGBTQ people and economic justice, Charlottesville, VA, October 2013.

I'm Y.M Carrington, and I Am An Economic Justice Organizer and Activist. My focus is on economic justice for LGBTQ people and communities of color.

But I am so much more. I'm not only the person to call when you need to get the word out for your march, fundraiser, or speaking event. I'm one of the people you call when you need to create strategy, or develop materials, or set personal goals, or when you just need emotional support. When you're broke, jobless, homeless, or in a dangerous situation, I'm that person you call to help figure out a plan for getting out. 


"Trans Visibility, Trans Justice" discussion with CeCe McDonald, November 2014

I am an expert at managing personal and organizational crises, because a lifetime of systematic economic, racial, and gender discrimination has forced me to be. I counsel people through struggles that are too frightening, shame-inducing, complicated, or depressing for most folks to handle. But you know what? I love this work. This work is life-giving for me. When I know that another person has not only survived personal crisis but transformed their life, I am energized and even more determined to keep fighting for economic justice.

But you know what I need to keep going? A salary. Or more accurately, a salary for myself and an operating budget for my organizing-service delivery-consulting work. With my goal of $50,000, I will have $35,000 for the year to pay for housing, utilities, food, health care, and other life necessities. The remaining $15,000 will be used to fund my organizing expenses, which include:
  • Travel (for work meetings, conferences, workshops)
  • Printing services
  • Technology (internet access, website maintenance)
  • Emergency assistance costs (for folks facing housing/personal crises)

I need and deserve to get paid for my work. Right now I survive solely on donations. While I am appreciative of the support I get from friends, I cannot continue to put my own health and wellness needs aside while I fight for the well-being of other people. Too often, the people who are the strongest fighters for human justice have suffered through bone-crushing poverty and hardship alone. For me, our historic neglect of committed, dedicated activists is unconscionable. So now, I'm requesting a paycheck and a budget for my work, to pay for my personal expenses and fund the essential life-saving work that I am already doing.

If the charities and nonprofits that are supposed to be doing economic crisis work won't hire me, I'll just hire myself.

story:
At 21 yrs old I was diagnosed with degenerative arthritis. 

Here I am 17 yrs later and still able to keep healthy and in shape.

One point in my life I was a professional fighter. Hopes of climbing the ranks were cut short because of my first shoulder surgery. Not long after that I had a procedure on my other shoulder. Two shoulder surgeries before I was 24 years old. 

By 30 my right hip was worked on. All a result of my arthritis.

I battled depression, anger and the utmost frustration anyone can imagine. I felt weak, going from athlete to struggling to lift a coffee mug. 

It took time but I managed to get back in the gym. Over the years I have become a personal trainer and strength and conditioning coach. All the while still battling the grinding gears we call joints. 

Exercises for the good days and bad days.

I am no arthritis expert. I have, however, managed to achieve the greatest fitness level in my life as I approach 40. This web series will provide an education on how I did it and the various exercises and workouts that help me daily stay in shape and defy the odds. 

Every exercise has a variation, some have multiple. I will be covering suspension training, body-weight training, heavy-bag workouts and more. And with social media I will take video requests! 

How is this different from all the other fitness videos out there? I have lived half of my life waking up in some sort of pain (I still do today). I am able to do the exercises that will be in the web series despite my condition. I am not a fitness model or bodybuilder. I am the guy next-door that has been there and done that. I manage to be a husband, father of 3 and full time college instructor. All while staying in shape and fighting arthritis through fitness.

    Click play!

    The web series will have something to offer everybody. The videos will work body control/mechanics, functional movements, all of which the weekend warrior or the athlete truly need.

    The funding goal is fairly low for a campaign such as this. The goal amount will merely cover startup costs. I am hopeful that goal amount is far exceeded. However, just to get off the ground will be amazing for me as well as you, the supporter! 

      Many Ways to Help.

      Aside from being a supporter directly to this campaign you can also help by sharing. One of your family or friends might benefit from this fitness web series. Maybe they need a consistent outlet of fitness for weight loss, or over coming ailments such as mine. You could share this campaign with them or even share the social media pages and they can follow as the movement grows. 

      Facebook

      Twitter

      Instagram

      Thanks for your time and support! 

      Jensen Hendriks

story:
WHY WE RIDE 

FIVE YEARS STRONG 

In April 2010, Wyatt Carroll Lewis-Wallace was born 12 weeks premature. Though he fought hard, he passed away after a few short hours. In his honor, a group of close friends set out to raise money for the March of Dimes by riding from San Francisco to Santa Monica in 4 days in March 2011. Though waylaid by torrential rains, flooding and road closures, we exceeded our fundraising goal.

This year, as Wyatt turns 5, we ride again to honor his memory and all of the precious little ones that have left us too soon. We also ride to celebrate the little ones on their way into our lives and in our hearts. We know that they all have a little guardian angel watching over them, guiding them on their journeys. For us, we celebrate Christian's and Holden's birth, who also tried as hard as they could to come early! 

It makes us proud to support an organization like the March of Dimes to help prematurity and support baby health.
